original: @122a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @122a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i sarba ra ha s+ya ni bandha ra ha pra 'di po n'a ma /
analyzed: shr'i sarba ra ha s+ya ni bandha ra ha pra 'di po n'a ma /
translated: Śrī-sarva-rahasya-nirbhandha-rahasya-pradīpa-nāma.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal thams cad gsang ba'i bshad spyar gsang ba'i sgron ma /
analyzed: dpal thams cad gsang ba'i bshad spyar gsang ba'i sgron ma /
translated: The Secret Lamp of the Explanatory Application of the Glorious Secret of Everything.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: gang zhig rnal 'byor rgyud du gsang byas pa //
analyzed: gang zhig rnal 'byor rgyud du gsang byas pa //
translated: That which is kept secret in the Yoga Tantra,

original: rang gi sku gsung thugs dngos sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: rang gi sku gsung thugs dngos sna tshogs pa //
translated: The various actualities of one's body, speech, and mind,

original: thams cad gsang ba'i rgyud ni de brten nas //
analyzed: thams cad gsang ba'i rgyud ni de brten nas //
translated: All the tantras of the secret depend on that,

original: gsang ba'i sgron ma bshad spyar brtsam par bya //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sgron ma bshad spyar brtsam par bya //
translated: So I shall compose the explanatory application of the Secret Lamp.

original: lus kyi tshogs rgyas par gyur pa rnams ni spyin pa la sogs pa dka' ba'i spyod pa rnams kyis yun ring por byang chub par 'dod pa rnams la /
analyzed: lus kyi tshogs rgyas par gyur pa rnams ni spyin pa la sogs pa dka' ba'i spyod pa rnams kyis yun ring por byang chub par 'dod pa rnams la /
translated: For those who wish to attain enlightenment through the difficult practices of generosity and so forth, having accumulated the vast collections of the body,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate enthusiasm for perfect complete enlightenment,

original: mi rnams kyi lus ni phyag dar @122b gyi phung po dang mtshungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi lus ni phyag dar @122b gyi phung po dang mtshungs pa yin gyi /
translated: The bodies of humans are like heaps of dust.

original: sems ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu dang mtshungs pa yin no zhes ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu dang mtshungs pa yin no zhes ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The mind is like a wish-fulfilling gem.🔽To demonstrate this, he says,

original: 'byung lnga nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung lnga nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “The five elements themselves,

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyis bskyed pa sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rgyur gyur pa sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams te lnga po nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyis bskyed pa sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rgyur gyur pa sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams te lnga po nyid kyis so //
translated: “The five elements” are the five elements of earth, water, fire, wind, and space, which are the causes of the various sufferings produced by afflictions and karma.🔽“

original: nges pa ni brtag mi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni brtag mi dgos pa'o //
translated: Certainty” means that there is no need to investigate.🔽“

original: mthong ba dag ces bya ba ni tshad mar grub pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dag ces bya ba ni tshad mar grub pa'o //
translated: Seeing” means that they are established as valid cognitions.

original: mi rnams kyi lus de lta bu yin du zin kyang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya bar spyar ro //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi lus de lta bu yin du zin kyang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya bar spyar ro //
translated: Even though the bodies of humans are like that, they can become buddhas.🔽What is done?

original: ci zhig byas pas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas pas she na /
translated: What is it that is done?🔽

original: rang sems rab tu bsgoms pa ste rab kyi mthar thug par bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: rang sems rab tu bsgoms pa ste rab kyi mthar thug par bsgoms pas so //
translated: One’s mind is well cultivated,” that is, cultivated to the highest degree.

original: ji ltar bsgoms pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgoms pas she na /
translated: How is it cultivated?

original: dngos der bsgoms pas zhes bya ba ste dngos po der 'gyur ba'i phyir te sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos der bsgoms pas zhes bya ba ste dngos po der 'gyur ba'i phyir te sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase by meditating on that entity means that by meditating on the reality of the mind, one becomes that entity, that is, a buddha.

original: dngos po gang sems kyi de kho na nyid sgom pa gang yin pas so //
analyzed: dngos po gang sems kyi de kho na nyid sgom pa gang yin pas so //
translated: The phrase by meditating on that entity means that by meditating on the reality of the mind, one becomes that entity, that is, a buddha.

original: nges par zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas te de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas te de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase one will certainly become a buddha means that one will certainly become a tathagata.

original: sems kyi che ba'i bdag nyid gzhan dag kyang ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi che ba'i bdag nyid gzhan dag kyang ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach other great natures of the mind, he says:

original: rang shes gsang bzhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang shes gsang bzhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The secret of self-knowledge,🔽The mind itself, endowed with the qualities of glory, is the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: rang gi ye shes te rang gi sems nyid ni dpal gyi yon tan dang ldan pas na sangs rgyas rnams kyang rab tu 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: rang gi ye shes te rang gi sems nyid ni dpal gyi yon tan dang ldan pas na sangs rgyas rnams kyang rab tu 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar mdzad do //
translated: The buddhas bow down to it and pay homage to it.

original: rang gi sems ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi sems ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like?

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called secret because it is supramundane.

original: dam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad las mchog tu khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad las mchog tu khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is supreme because it is superior to all supramundane states.

original: de'i ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sangs rgyas ye shes bla med de //
analyzed: de'i ci'i phyir zhe na / sangs rgyas ye shes bla med de //
translated: Why is that?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because it is the unsurpassed wisdom of the Buddha.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi sems nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i ye shes yin pas so //🔽dris pa gnyis su snang ba nyid kyis 'khrul cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi sems nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i ye shes yin pas so // dris pa gnyis su snang ba nyid kyis 'khrul cing /
translated: Because one’s own mind is the unsurpassed wisdom of the Tathāgatas.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i so so'i skye bo'i sems te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i so so'i skye bo'i sems te /
translated: The mind of the afflicted ordinary person is confused by the appearance of duality.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the wisdom of the Buddha?

original: gnyis med gnyis kyi tshul can te //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis med gnyis kyi tshul can te // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is nondual, having the mode of duality.

original: de ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin te /🔽gnyis su snang ba stong pa nyid kyi @123a * //
analyzed: de ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin te / gnyis su snang ba stong pa nyid kyi @123a * //
translated: It is the nondual wisdom,

original: rang gi ngo bor gyur par yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gyur par yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the realization of the emptiness of the appearance of duality as its own essence.

original: de lta bu yin du zin kyang gnyis kyi tshul can te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu yin du zin kyang gnyis kyi tshul can te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Even though it is like that, it has the mode of duality.

original: brdzun yin du zin kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i tshul du so sor snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brdzun yin du zin kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i tshul du so sor snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Even though it is false, it appears as the mode of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de ni mi bden pa yin /
analyzed: de ni mi bden pa yin /
translated: Therefore, it is not true.

original: glo bur gyi 'khrul pa can yin gyi /
analyzed: glo bur gyi 'khrul pa can yin gyi /
translated: It is a temporary error.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin pas /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin pas /
translated: It is the primordial wisdom that is naturally nondual.

original: rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the primordial wisdom of the Buddha by nature.

original: de lta bu'i ye shes nyid la ni sangs rgyas rnams kyang rab tu 'dud par mdzad de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ye shes nyid la ni sangs rgyas rnams kyang rab tu 'dud par mdzad de /
translated: The Buddhas themselves bow down to that primordial wisdom.

original: chos kyi sku la sogs pas gtso bor gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la sogs pas gtso bor gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: It is the principal one with the dharmakāya and so forth.

original: de bas na rang sems nyid la phyag 'tshal ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rang sems nyid la phyag 'tshal ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, I pay homage to my own mind.

original: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba ni rtag par rab tu 'dud ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba ni rtag par rab tu 'dud ces bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the homage is called “I constantly bow down.”

original: 'di ni khyad par du 'phags pa nyid du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par du 'phags pa nyid du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is said to be the most exalted.

original: 'dis ni shin tu myur du byang chub ma thob cing bskal pa grangs med pa gsum mam ;
analyzed: 'dis ni shin tu myur du byang chub ma thob cing bskal pa grangs med pa gsum mam ;
translated: By this, one does not attain enlightenment quickly, but in three incalculable aeons.

original: mang por rab tu 'dud do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mang por rab tu 'dud do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: bow down to the many.

original: yang dag par phyag 'tshal ba rnams ni myur ba nyid du byang chub rtogs pas yang phyag 'tshal bar mi byed do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yang dag par phyag 'tshal ba rnams ni myur ba nyid du byang chub rtogs pas yang phyag 'tshal bar mi byed do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Those who bow down perfectly do not bow down again, because they quickly realize enlightenment. This is the intended meaning.

original: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With just this in mind, he says whoever, etc.

original: chos thams cad dmigs pa la rang gi sems ni gnyis su snang ba nub par gyur pa ni bdag med pa ste rgyu nyid kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs pa la rang gi sems ni gnyis su snang ba nub par gyur pa ni bdag med pa ste rgyu nyid kyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: One's own mind, which is the objective support of all phenomena, is the absence of self, the subsiding of the appearance of duality. This is the application to the cause.

original: de las yang dag par byung ba ni yang dag par shes pas sangs rgyas kyi ngo bor byung ba ste /
analyzed: de las yang dag par byung ba ni yang dag par shes pas sangs rgyas kyi ngo bor byung ba ste /
translated: The arising from that is the arising as the essence of a Buddha through right knowledge.

original: 'bras bu 'di kho na nyid kyi sbyor ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di kho na nyid kyi sbyor ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: This is the application to the result, the reality itself. This is the meaning.

original: / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid dbyer med pa'i ye shes ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te smra bsam las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid dbyer med pa'i ye shes ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te smra bsam las 'das pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the indivisibility of the reality of cause and effect is nondual knowledge, beyond speech and thought.

original: de las byung ba ni 'di dag ma lus pa rdzogs par gyur pa yin pas na /🔽gnyis med ye shes las byung ba //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni 'di dag ma lus pa rdzogs par gyur pa yin pas na / gnyis med ye shes las byung ba //
translated: Since all of these are completely perfected from that,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said, “arising from nondual wisdom.”

original: de'i 'og tu /🔽sdug dang mi sdug rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu / sdug dang mi sdug rnam spangs pa //
translated: After that,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said, “abandoning the attractive and unattractive.”

original: sdug pa ni thob par bya ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sdug pa ni thob par bya ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The attractive are phenomena to be attained.

original: mi sdug pa ni spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams te de ma lus pa rnam par spangs pa ni thob dang spangs pa mthar thug pa'i bdag nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams te de ma lus pa rnam par spangs pa ni thob dang spangs pa mthar thug pa'i bdag nyid thob pa'o //
translated: The unattractive are phenomena to be abandoned. The complete abandonment of those is the attainment of the perfection of attainment and abandonment.

original: de ltar gyur ba'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni ci la @123b yang phyag ni mi 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni ci la @123b yang phyag ni mi 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The yogin who has become like that “does not pay homage to anything.”

original: bya ba byas pa'i sgrub pa la sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa'i sgrub pa la sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is engaged in the practice of having done what was to be done.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par phyag 'tshal ba de nyid gsal bar mdzad cing de nyid la 'jig rten rnams nges par spyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par phyag 'tshal ba de nyid gsal bar mdzad cing de nyid la 'jig rten rnams nges par spyar ba'i phyir /
translated: The Bhagavān clarifies that very homage and in order to engage the world in that very homage, he says:

original: ma skyes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “The unborn, etc.

original: rang gi shes pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi shes pa ste /
translated: ” One’s own consciousness,

original: rang gi sems gnyis su snang ba dang bral ba'i tshul gyis sngar ma skyes pa de'i tshul du bskyed la /
analyzed: rang gi sems gnyis su snang ba dang bral ba'i tshul gyis sngar ma skyes pa de'i tshul du bskyed la /
translated: one’s own mind, in the manner of non-production, in the manner of non-arising, one should generate it in the manner of freedom from the appearance of duality.

original: skyes par gyur pa'i pha rol te //
analyzed: skyes par gyur pa'i pha rol te //
translated: Having become born, on the other side,

original: rjes la sangs rgyas kyi skur ni zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rtag tu zhes bya ba rtag pa nyid kyis bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rjes la sangs rgyas kyi skur ni zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rtag tu zhes bya ba rtag pa nyid kyis bsgom par bya ste /
translated: afterwards, one should meditate on the Buddha’s form, i.e., on the Buddha’s image, constantly, i.e., by means of constancy.

original: phyag 'tshal ba de la rang nyid de nyid la rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid kyis zhugs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba de la rang nyid de nyid la rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid kyis zhugs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In that homage, one should enter into reality with one’s own body, speech, and mind. This is the meaning.

original: de la lus kyis rab tu zhugs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku las tha dad pa'i rang gi lus mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyis rab tu zhugs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku las tha dad pa'i rang gi lus mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: There, the entry with the body is the non-apprehension of one’s own body as separate from the Buddha’s body.

original: tshig gis rab tu zhugs pa ni sangs rgyas ni bdag go zhes smra'o //
analyzed: tshig gis rab tu zhugs pa ni sangs rgyas ni bdag go zhes smra'o //
translated: The entry with speech is the statement, “The Buddha is myself.”

original: 'di gnyis las gzhan du yid mi g-yeng ba ni sems kyis rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis las gzhan du yid mi g-yeng ba ni sems kyis rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: The entry with the mind is the non-distraction of the mind from these two.

original: lus la sogs pa'i rab tu 'jug pa 'di nyid ni de'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag 'tshal ba'i mchog yin te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i rab tu 'jug pa 'di nyid ni de'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag 'tshal ba'i mchog yin te /
translated: This very engagement of body, etc. is the supreme homage of his body, speech, and mind.

original: myur ba nyid du byang chub sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: myur ba nyid du byang chub sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is the means of quickly accomplishing enlightenment.

original: 'dir yang sangs rgyas kyi sgras byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyang gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang sangs rgyas kyi sgras byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyang gzung ste /
translated: Here also, the word “Buddha” includes the Bodhisattvas, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsdus pa nyid ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i tshul gyis rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la bsgom par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsdus pa nyid ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i tshul gyis rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la bsgom par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the inclusion of all the Ones-Gone-Thus is the yoga to be cultivated in the Yoga Tantra by way of the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, etc.

original: rnal 'byor 'di la ni 'di'i skal ba dang ldan pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'di la ni 'di'i skal ba dang ldan pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “This yoga is not for those who are not fortunate,”

original: rnal 'byor pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “yoga practitioner,” etc.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Here, yoga is nondual intuition.

original: de nyid ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu yod pa yin pas na rnal 'byor ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu yod pa yin pas na rnal 'byor ba ste /
translated: Since that very [intuition] is always present by the method explained above, it is a yoga practitioner.

original: sems can thams cad do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad do //
translated: all sentient beings.

original: gal te thams cad rnal 'byor pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad rnal 'byor pa yin na /
translated: If all are yogis,

original: 'dir skal ba med pa ni 'ga' yang med pas 'khor bar ga la 'khor bar 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: 'dir skal ba med pa ni 'ga' yang med pas 'khor bar ga la 'khor bar 'gyur zhe na //
translated: then since there is no one here who is unfortunate, how can there be cyclic existence?

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽ni zhes bya ba'i @124a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / ni zhes bya ba'i @124a * //
translated: Therefore he says, “afflictions, etc. ”🔽The word “na”

original: sgra ni dga' ba'i don te /
analyzed: sgra ni dga' ba'i don te /
translated: has the sense of “na” .

original: nyon mongs pa dang bag chags kyis sun phyung bas 'gro ba de dang der 'khor bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bag chags kyis sun phyung bas 'gro ba de dang der 'khor bar gyur ba'o //
translated: By being wearied by the afflictions and the instinctual natures, one cycles in this and that realm.

original: lus can zhes bya ba ni lus thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: lus can zhes bya ba ni lus thob pa rnams so //
translated: “ Embodied” means those who have obtained a body.

original: rgyu gang gis nyon mongs pa dang bag chags kyis lus 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis nyon mongs pa dang bag chags kyis lus 'thob ce na /
translated: By what cause does one obtain a body through the afflictions and the instinctual natures?

original: de'i phyir sdug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore he says, “attraction, etc. ”

original: sdug pa ni gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa ni gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa'o //
translated: Attraction is to a place, possessions, etc.

original: mi sdug pa ni de dag gis rnam par 'byed pa'i khyad par la yongs su rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni de dag gis rnam par 'byed pa'i khyad par la yongs su rtogs pa'o //
translated: Aversion is the discrimination of the differences of those .

original: de las ni bag chags te /
analyzed: de las ni bag chags te /
translated: From that there is the instinctual nature.

original: de nas yang sdug pa dang mi sdug pa ni rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang sdug pa dang mi sdug pa ni rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Then, the pleasant and unpleasant are distinguished.

original: de nas de gnyis thob pa dang spang bar srid par skye la /
analyzed: de nas de gnyis thob pa dang spang bar srid par skye la /
translated: Then, through the attainment of those two, one is born in existence,

original: des ni lus 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni lus 'thob pa yin no //
translated: and one obtains a body.

original: dris pa lha'i lus dang ldan pa rnams dga' ba'i tshal la sogs par 'khor ba na /
analyzed: dris pa lha'i lus dang ldan pa rnams dga' ba'i tshal la sogs par 'khor ba na /
translated: When those endowed with divine bodies circle in the Joyous Grove and so forth,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni ci zhig yod /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni ci zhig yod /
translated: what is happiness and what is suffering?

original: ji ltar na 'khor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'khor ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is there circling?🔽It is said:

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Suffering, etc.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang las las byung ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang longs spyod dang gnas rnams ni /
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang las las byung ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang longs spyod dang gnas rnams ni /
translated: This is the body, enjoyments, and abode that arise from afflictions and karma,

original: gang gis spyod pa dang gang la spyod pa dang / gang du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis spyod pa dang gang la spyod pa dang / gang du spyod pa ste /
translated: which are the one who experiences, that which is experienced, and the place of experience.

original: de ni lus dang lhan cig 'byung bas na lus 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni lus dang lhan cig 'byung bas na lus 'byung ba'o //
translated: Since that arises together with the body, it is the arising of the body.

original: gang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs de nyid ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs de nyid ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: That very collection of mind and mental factors is suffering.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig zag bcas nyer len pa'i //
analyzed: gang zhig zag bcas nyer len pa'i //
translated: That which is contaminated and appropriated

original: phung po de dag thabs bcas kyang //
analyzed: phung po de dag thabs bcas kyang //
translated: Those aggregates, along with the means,🔽are the origin of suffering, the world,

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lha gnas srid pa'ang de dag yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lha gnas srid pa'ang de dag yin //
translated: and the abode of gods, and also of existence.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar yin na go /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro // de ltar yin na go /
translated: Thus it is explained.🔽If that is so, then how can there be liberation,

original: 'jig rten rnams sdug bsngal ba yin na ji ltar thar bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams sdug bsngal ba yin na ji ltar thar bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: if the worlds are suffering?

original: sems de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The text says “that mind,” etc.

original: sdug bsngal de gnon cing shes pa'i 'gro ba ni sems kyis so sor rtogs shing yongs su shes par brten pa ni rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de gnon cing shes pa'i 'gro ba ni sems kyis so sor rtogs shing yongs su shes par brten pa ni rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The world is the basis of the realization and knowledge of that suffering, which is the realization of the mind.

original: gdams pa'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: gdams pa'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: This is the root of the precepts.

original: de bas na gdams pa po ni 'khor ba las sgrol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gdams pa po ni 'khor ba las sgrol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the one who gives the precepts liberates from cyclic existence.

original: de su zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de su zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Who is that?

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The text says “Vairocana,” etc.

original: thams cad du thogs pa med cing shin tu rnam par dag la rtag pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi tshul can yin pas na /
analyzed: thams cad du thogs pa med cing shin tu rnam par dag la rtag pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi tshul can yin pas na /
translated: He is the one who has the method of the always pure and unobstructed gnosis.

original: @124b khyab pa rnam par snang mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: @124b khyab pa rnam par snang mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: He is Vairochana because he pervades with his exalted body, speech, and mind.

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos kyi longs spyod skyed par mdzad pas na rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos kyi longs spyod skyed par mdzad pas na rgyal ba'o //
translated: He is the Victor because he generates the enjoyment of Dharma in all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas na mgon po ste ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku dang rim bzhin du spyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas na mgon po ste ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku dang rim bzhin du spyar ro //
translated: He is the Lord because he acts for the sake of all migrating beings in all aspects.

original: de ltar dang po'i tshig ni ba stan pa yin la 'og ma gsum ni bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar dang po'i tshig ni ba stan pa yin la 'og ma gsum ni bshad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the first word is the statement and the latter three are the explanation.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de /
translated: All buddhas are all the qualities of a buddha.

original: de rnams kyi ro gcig pa ni bsdus pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ro gcig pa ni bsdus pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Their single taste is called their collection.

original: de ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi don yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of Vairochana.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
translated: All buddhas are the qualities of a buddha.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas rnams la logs shig tu byas nas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas rnams la logs shig tu byas nas bshad pa yin te /
translated: They are explained as being separate from the buddhas.

original: 'dis na / sangs rgyas thams cad rtogs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'dis na / sangs rgyas thams cad rtogs 'gyur ba //
translated: Thus,🔽one realizes all the buddhas.🔽

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: This is what is meant by the line: one realizes all the Buddhas.

original: 'di ni rgyal ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyal ba'i don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the Victor.

original: sangs rgyas 'khor ba sgrol ba po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'khor ba sgrol ba po //
translated: The line: the Buddha is the savior of the world

original: zhes bya ba ni mgon po'i don yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mgon po'i don yin no //
translated: means the meaning of the Lord.

original: dris pa bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi don gyi mthar byon pa yin nam /
analyzed: dris pa bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi don gyi mthar byon pa yin nam /
translated: The question is asked: Has the Lord come to the end of his own aim,

original: 'on te gzhan dag kyang sgrol bar mdzad pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dag kyang sgrol bar mdzad pa yin nam /
translated: or does he also save others,

original: 'on te ltos par mi mdzad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ltos par mi mdzad pa yin zhe na /
translated: or does he not care?

original: de'i phyir sems can kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: for the sake of all sentient beings, etc.

original: sems can kun la phan pa de nyid ni don yin te 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan pa de nyid ni don yin te 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very aim for the sake of all sentient beings is the aim, because it is desired.

original: de la thugs rje 'byung ba gang yin pa de nyid ni nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: de la thugs rje 'byung ba gang yin pa de nyid ni nyams pa yin te /
translated: That very compassion which arises for them is the loss,

original: rab kyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab kyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the ultimate perfection.

original: de dang yang dag par ldan pa ni rtag tu bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de dang yang dag par ldan pa ni rtag tu bcas pa ste /
translated: He is always engaged in that, because he is endowed with it.

original: de bas na btang snyoms med pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na btang snyoms med pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is intended that he is without equanimity.

original: gdams pa ba stan par bya ba'i phyir rgyu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gdams pa ba stan par bya ba'i phyir rgyu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the instruction, he declares the cause, etc.

original: shin tu myur ba dang shin tu bde bar byang chub sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni rgyu'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu myur ba dang shin tu bde bar byang chub sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni rgyu'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The application which causes the attainment of enlightenment very quickly and very easily is the reality of the cause.

original: de'i mnyam par sbyor ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mnyam par sbyor ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The meditative concentration on that is the meditative equipoise.

original: de las gang du zhes bya ba ni ba stan pa de'i gong du zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: de las gang du zhes bya ba ni ba stan pa de'i gong du zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: From that, where? means from that instruction, the meaning of which is higher.

original: /'bras bu'i de nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi sku'o //
analyzed: /'bras bu'i de nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi sku'o //
translated: The reality of the result is the Buddha-body.

original: de ston pa ni de'i sbyor ba ston par mdzad pa'o /
analyzed: de ston pa ni de'i sbyor ba ston par mdzad pa'o /
translated: The teaching of that is the teaching of the application to that.

original: ci bcom ldan 'das de gzhan dag kyang ston par mdzad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci bcom ldan 'das de gzhan dag kyang ston par mdzad dam zhe na /
translated: Does the Lord teach that to others?

original: 'bad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'bras bu'i de nyid yang dag zhugs //
analyzed: 'bad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'bras bu'i de nyid yang dag zhugs //
translated: He declares the effort, etc.🔽The reality of the result is the entry into the reality of the cause.🔽The reality of the result is the Buddha-body.🔽The teaching of that is the teaching of the application to that.🔽Does the Lord teach that to others?🔽He declares the effort, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu @125a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu @125a * //
translated: The reality of the result is the entry into the reality of the cause.

original: dang 'bras bu mi phyed pa'i ye shes la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa la yang dag par zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni rgyu'i de kho na nyid mi 'dod de /
analyzed: dang 'bras bu mi phyed pa'i ye shes la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa la yang dag par zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni rgyu'i de kho na nyid mi 'dod de /
translated: The yogi who has entered into the perfection of the gnosis of the indivisibility of cause and effect does not desire the reality of the cause.

original: bya ba byas pa nyid rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir slar 'dod par mi byed do //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa nyid rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir slar 'dod par mi byed do //
translated: Because he has realized the state of having done what was to be done, he does not desire it again.

original: de bas na thun mtshams su gnyis pa la sogs par ni 'bras bu'i rnal 'byor nyid bya'i //
analyzed: de bas na thun mtshams su gnyis pa la sogs par ni 'bras bu'i rnal 'byor nyid bya'i //
translated: Therefore, in the second session and so forth, he should practice the yoga of the effect.

original: rgyu'i rnal 'byor ni so sor rab tu sgom pa yin la sngar grub pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid la yang dag par zhugs par gyur na /
analyzed: rgyu'i rnal 'byor ni so sor rab tu sgom pa yin la sngar grub pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid la yang dag par zhugs par gyur na /
translated: The yoga of the cause is cultivated individually, and having entered into the reality of the effect by the previously established process,

original: de nyid gal te yang 'dod par gyur na ci 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gal te yang 'dod par gyur na ci 'gyur zhe na /
translated: if he should desire it again, what would happen?

original: gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says “wherever” and so forth.

original: gnas skabs gang du 'dod pa skyes par gyur pa de nyid 'khor ba'i bag chags yin zhing dngos grub kyi gegs su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang du 'dod pa skyes par gyur pa de nyid 'khor ba'i bag chags yin zhing dngos grub kyi gegs su gyur pa yin te /
translated: Wherever the desire arises, that itself is the latent tendency of cyclic existence and an obstacle to spiritual powers.

original: slar srid pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: slar srid pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the cause of rebirth.

original: de bas na 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid la yang dag par zhugs pas ni dngos grub kyi mthar thug pa ba stan par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid la yang dag par zhugs pas ni dngos grub kyi mthar thug pa ba stan par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: Therefore, one who is engaged in the reality of the result should be taught the culmination of power.

original: 'di ni gdams pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gdams pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the statement of instruction.

original: 'dir dris pa gal te 'gro ba'i don la grogs su mdzad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dir dris pa gal te 'gro ba'i don la grogs su mdzad pa yin na /
translated: Here, it is asked: If it is the case that it is the companion for the benefit of beings,

original: de'i tshe des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgom pa ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: de'i tshe des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgom pa ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
translated: then why did he not teach the meditation of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas who practice through the door of the perfections?

original: yid la 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yid la 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “The various meditations are taught by the Bhagavān according to the wishes of sentient beings.”

original: yid la 'dod pa ni sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa ste des na sgom pa sna tshogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su rtogs shing gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yid la 'dod pa ni sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa ste des na sgom pa sna tshogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su rtogs shing gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The wishes of sentient beings are the desires of sentient beings. Therefore, the various meditations are taught by the Bhagavān according to those.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: theg pa de'i nang nas gdams pa gcig pa nyid ba stan pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: theg pa de'i nang nas gdams pa gcig pa nyid ba stan pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The teaching of the single instruction in that vehicle is stated by “that” and so forth.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The word “also” has the sense of distinction.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i sgom pa gcig gis rnal 'byor gyi de kho na nyid thams cad dang 'brel par gnas pa gcig po de nyid ni rnal 'byor 'byung ba'o ;
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i sgom pa gcig gis rnal 'byor gyi de kho na nyid thams cad dang 'brel par gnas pa gcig po de nyid ni rnal 'byor 'byung ba'o ;
translated: The single abiding in the connection with all realities of yoga by means of the single meditation just explained is the origin of yoga.

original: des na gdams pa gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na gdams pa gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the single instruction.

original: da ni gtso bo ston te /🔽de yang rnal 'byor nyid las sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ma lus pa 'thob par 'byung ba 'di yin pas na rnal 'byor 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: da ni gtso bo ston te / de yang rnal 'byor nyid las sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ma lus pa 'thob par 'byung ba 'di yin pas na rnal 'byor 'byung ba ste /
translated: Now, the principal matter is taught.🔽And since the origin of all the qualities of the Buddha comes from yoga itself, it is the origin of yoga.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de las @125b di sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad 'thob pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de las @125b di sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad 'thob pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the meditation of the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas does not have the origin of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo la spyod pa'i sgom pa las ni de 'byung ba yin mong kyi /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo la spyod pa'i sgom pa las ni de 'byung ba yin mong kyi /
translated: It arises from the meditation of one who practices the door of the perfections, but

original: 'on kyang rnal 'byor 'di dang 'dra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnal 'byor 'di dang 'dra ba ma yin te /
translated: it is not the same as this yoga.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du dka' ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po de rnams las 'byung ba yin te gdams pa ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du dka' ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po de rnams las 'byung ba yin te gdams pa ba stan pa'o //
translated: It arises from those ten perfections, which are completed through difficult practices over three incalculable aeons.

original: gdams pa ba stan pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gdams pa ba stan pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the instruction is:

original: sangs rgyas rjes dran zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes dran zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: “Recollection of the Buddha, etc.”

original: rjes su dran pa gnyis kyi tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa las /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa gnyis kyi tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa las /
translated: From the completion of the two collections through the two recollections,

original: rkang gnyis te lha dang mi de rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rkang gnyis te lha dang mi de rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa'o //
translated: one becomes the supreme of humans and gods, a perfect, complete Buddha.

original: bha gar ling+ga zhes bya ba ni zla ba dang mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: bha gar ling+ga zhes bya ba ni zla ba dang mtshan ma'o //
translated: “The liṅga in the bhaga” means the moon and the sign.

original: rab tu gzhag ces bya ba ni legs par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gzhag ces bya ba ni legs par bsgom pa'o //
translated: “Well-placed” means well-cultivated.

original: sangs rgyas skur zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi skur bsgom pa ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas skur zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi skur bsgom pa ste //
translated: The Buddha-body means the meditation on oneself as the Buddha-body.

original: bsgom pa 'di nyid ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa 'di nyid ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: This meditation is the recollection of the Buddha.

original: rnal 'byor pa des sangs rgyas sprin zhes bya ba bsdus nas byon pa'i rgyal ba thams cad rnam par bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa des sangs rgyas sprin zhes bya ba bsdus nas byon pa'i rgyal ba thams cad rnam par bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: The yogi, having gathered the Buddha-cloud, should meditate on all the Victors who have come forth,

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba stan par bya ba'i phyir rang gi snying gar gzhug par bya'o /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba stan par bya ba'i phyir rang gi snying gar gzhug par bya'o /
translated: and he should place them in his heart in order to demonstrate the complete enlightenment.

original: de nas snying gar zla ba la gnas pa'i rdo rje bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas snying gar zla ba la gnas pa'i rdo rje bsam par bya ste /
translated: Then he should think of the vajra located on the moon in his heart,

original: de yang / sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos kun ni //🔽snying ga'i rdo rje rnam par bsam //
analyzed: de yang / sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos kun ni // snying ga'i rdo rje rnam par bsam //
translated: and that also is the totality of all the Buddhas,

original: zhes rdo rje rtse mo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes rdo rje rtse mo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said in the Vajra Peak:🔽“The totality of all the Buddhas🔽is thought of as the vajra in the heart.”

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: This is the recollection of the Buddha.

original: chos rjes su dran pa ba stan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rjes su dran pa ba stan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the recollection of the Dharma,🔽he says,

original: bha gar ling+ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te bshad ma thag pa'i tshul du snying ga'i zla bar rdo rje bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bha gar ling+ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te bshad ma thag pa'i tshul du snying ga'i zla bar rdo rje bsam pa'o //
translated: The vajra is in the bhaga means that one should imagine the vajra in the moon at the heart, in the manner just explained.

original: rdo rje chos ni zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ba rnams kyi snying po rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje chos ni zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ba rnams kyi snying po rnams so //
translated: The vajra Dharma means the essences of the maṇḍala deities.

original: chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The Dharma cloud means the maṇḍala deities.

original: char rab 'bebs zhes bya ba ni snying ga'i rdo rje nyid las rnam par bsgom zhing brjod pa dang spro ba bya ba'o //
analyzed: char rab 'bebs zhes bya ba ni snying ga'i rdo rje nyid las rnam par bsgom zhing brjod pa dang spro ba bya ba'o //
translated: The rain is falling means that one should visualize, recite, and emanate from the vajra at the heart.

original: 'dir ling+ga zhes gang la bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ling+ga zhes gang la bya zhe na /
translated: Here, what is meant by the term liṅga?

original: mtshan ma ling+ga zhes bshad de //
analyzed: mtshan ma ling+ga zhes bshad de //
translated: The liṅga is explained as the sign.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'dir mtshan ma nyid la ling+ga zhes bshad kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mtshan ma nyid la ling+ga zhes bshad kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the sign itself is explained as the liṅga, not anything else.

original: mtshan ma de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And what is that sign?

original: phyag @126a * //
analyzed: phyag @126a * //
translated: The hand

original: rgya'i mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: rgya'i mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi //
translated: has four types of signs.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ting nge 'dzin brtan pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas phyag rgya nyid la mtshan ma zhes bshad de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin brtan pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas phyag rgya nyid la mtshan ma zhes bshad de /
translated: Since it is the intrinsic essence of the special stability of meditative concentration, the seal itself is explained as the sign.

original: de ni lha'i de kho na nyid ston par byed pa yin pas na phyag rgya'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: de ni lha'i de kho na nyid ston par byed pa yin pas na phyag rgya'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: Since it reveals the reality of the deity, it is the sign of the seal.

original: de yang dpal rdo rje rtse mo las ling+ga'i mtshan ma zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de yang dpal rdo rje rtse mo las ling+ga'i mtshan ma zhes bshad de /
translated: Moreover, the glorious Vajraśekhara explains the sign of the liṅga.

original: mtshan skyes blo ldan yin par 'dod //
analyzed: mtshan skyes blo ldan yin par 'dod //
translated: The wise one is considered to have the sign of the organ.

original: byang chub sems ni theg chen po //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni theg chen po //
translated: The Mahāyāna is the bodhisattva mind.

original: 'di ni ling+ga zhes byar grags //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ling+ga zhes byar grags // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is renowned as the liṅga.

original: rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mtshan ma dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma dang ; lha mo'i mtshan ma dang / khro bo rnams kyi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mtshan ma dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma dang ; lha mo'i mtshan ma dang / khro bo rnams kyi mtshan ma'o //
translated: The four types are the signs of the buddhas, the signs of the bodhisattvas, the signs of the goddesses, and the signs of the wrathful ones.

original: sangs rgyas smon pa ni nye bar mtshan pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas smon pa ni nye bar mtshan pa tsam du zad do //
translated: The buddhas are merely designated by the sign.

original: yang na rnam par dbye bas de rnam dbye'i dngos su ni 'di dag thams cad sangs rgyas yin te gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid bsgom pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na rnam par dbye bas de rnam dbye'i dngos su ni 'di dag thams cad sangs rgyas yin te gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid bsgom pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, by way of analysis, all of these are Buddhas, otherwise the yogis such as Bodhisattvas would not cultivate the reality of the result.

original: 'dir bha ga zhes gang la bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir bha ga zhes gang la bya zhe na /
translated: Here, what is meant by bhaga?

original: 'joms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te 'dir 'joms pas na bha ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'joms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te 'dir 'joms pas na bha ga zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said, “It is the destroyer, etc. ” Here, it is called bhaga because it destroys.

original: de nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: nyon mongs 'joms pa dam pa yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs 'joms pa dam pa yin //
translated: It is the supreme destroyer of afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: It is said:

original: gang nyon mongs pa 'jig cing 'joms pa mchog dam pa ste /
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa 'jig cing 'joms pa mchog dam pa ste /
translated: That which is the supreme, excellent destroyer and annihilator of afflictions,

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa'i bye brag rnams ni nyon mongs pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa'i bye brag rnams ni nyon mongs pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the various conceptual thoughts are afflictions.

original: de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis 'joms pa ni dman pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis 'joms pa ni dman pa yin la /
translated: The annihilation of those by Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas is inferior,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sgrib pa yin pas na nyon mongs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sgrib pa yin pas na nyon mongs pa yin te /
translated: For bodhisattvas, all these afflicted and unafflicted discriminations are obscurations to perfect complete enlightenment, and thus they are afflictions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Lord has also said, “Discrimination is the affliction of bodhisattvas.”

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa thams cad 'joms pa'i zag pa med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni 'dir bhag yin te /
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa thams cad 'joms pa'i zag pa med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni 'dir bhag yin te /
translated: Therefore, the uncontaminated wisdom that destroys all afflictions is here called bhaga.

original: ji skad du dpal rdo rje rtse mo las kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du dpal rdo rje rtse mo las kyang /
translated: As the glorious Vajra Peak Tantra teaches:

original: gang zhig nyon mongs nges 'joms pa //
analyzed: gang zhig nyon mongs nges 'joms pa //
translated: That which definitely destroys the afflictions

original: 'joms pas bha ga zhes bshad de //
analyzed: 'joms pas bha ga zhes bshad de //
translated: is explained as bhaga because it destroys.

original: shes rab nyon mongs de gsod pas //
analyzed: shes rab nyon mongs de gsod pas //
translated: Since wisdom kills those afflictions,

original: de bas shes rab @126b bha gar bshad //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas shes rab @126b bha gar bshad //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: wisdom is explained as bhaga.

original: don 'di nyid kyis na byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid la 'dir bha ga zhes bshad do //
analyzed: don 'di nyid kyis na byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid la 'dir bha ga zhes bshad do //
translated: By this very fact, the nature of the Thought of Enlightenment, the moon-disk, is here explained as the bhaga.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni byang chub kyi sems yin pas de ba stan par bya ba'i phyir sems can kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni byang chub kyi sems yin pas de ba stan par bya ba'i phyir sems can kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: Since its reality is the Thought of Enlightenment, in order to demonstrate that, he says, “of all sentient beings,” etc.

original: rang gi sems ni bha ga yin par spyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni bha ga yin par spyar ro //
translated: One should supply “the bhaga is one’s own mind.”

original: ji lta bu'i rang gi sems she na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i rang gi sems she na /
translated: What is one’s own mind like?

original: chos ni bsdus pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos ni bsdus pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “the totality of phenomena.”

original: chos rnams ma lus pa 'dzin pa po yin pa ste chos thams cad la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos rnams ma lus pa 'dzin pa po yin pa ste chos thams cad la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the holder of all phenomena without exception; it has the meaning of “the objective reference of all phenomena.”

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is it like?

original: bsad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “if it is killed,” etc.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “If” is a particle.

original: de yang gang rang nyid shi ba ni bsad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gang rang nyid shi ba ni bsad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, what is it? It is one’s own death.

original: bsad pa de ci zhig yin zhe na /🔽sems can kun gyi dngos po kun //
analyzed: bsad pa de ci zhig yin zhe na / sems can kun gyi dngos po kun //
translated: What is that killing?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He says, “all the entities of all sentient beings.”🔽What is that?

original: lus dang gnas dang longs spyod dang sems dang sems las byung bar chos kyi bsdu bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang gnas dang longs spyod dang sems dang sems las byung bar chos kyi bsdu bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The body, abode, enjoyments, mind, and mental factors are included in the inclusion of phenomena.

original: ci ltar bsad ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar bsad ce na /
translated: How is it killed?

original: chos bdag med pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽chos thams cad mi bden par yongs su brtags pa'i dmigs pas gnyis su gzung ba'i ngo bo'i bye brag tu snang ba nub par gyur pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / chos thams cad mi bden par yongs su brtags pa'i dmigs pas gnyis su gzung ba'i ngo bo'i bye brag tu snang ba nub par gyur pas /
translated: It is said.🔽By the object of observation that thoroughly investigates all phenomena as unreal, the appearance of the essence of the duality of apprehendeds and apprehenders subsides,

original: gnyis su med pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam gyi tshul gyis snang ba'i bdag nyid can sdig pa med cing ro mnyam par gyur pa ni chos bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam gyi tshul gyis snang ba'i bdag nyid can sdig pa med cing ro mnyam par gyur pa ni chos bdag med pa ste /
translated: and the mere consciousness of nonduality appears. The nature of that is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: rnal 'byor de la rang gi sems mnyam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor de la rang gi sems mnyam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: That yoga is one’s mind in meditative equipoise.

original: de bsang na rang nyid 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bsang na rang nyid 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: When it is killed, one dies.

original: rang nyid kyis kyang lus dang gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa gnyis su snang ba'i ngo bo nyid nub pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa yang rang snang ba'i bdag nyid can dang / sems can thams cad kyi snang ba'i bdag nyid can ro gcig ba nyid yin te /🔽'dir yang chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyi bdag nyid mnyam pa nyid gang gi tshe mi dmigs par gyur ba'i ye shes des rim pa bzhin du mi dmigs pa'i shes rab dang snying rje dang / 'di dag gnyis ka'i mtshan nyid can byang chub kyi sems ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par rtog @127a * //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis kyang lus dang gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa gnyis su snang ba'i ngo bo nyid nub pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa yang rang snang ba'i bdag nyid can dang / sems can thams cad kyi snang ba'i bdag nyid can ro gcig ba nyid yin te / 'dir yang chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyi bdag nyid mnyam pa nyid gang gi tshe mi dmigs par gyur ba'i ye shes des rim pa bzhin du mi dmigs pa'i shes rab dang snying rje dang / 'di dag gnyis ka'i mtshan nyid can byang chub kyi sems ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par rtog @127a * //
translated: Also, because the nature of the appearance of duality, such as body, place, and enjoyments, has disappeared, the nondual is also of the nature of self-appearance and of the same taste as the nature of the appearance of all sentient beings.

original: pa'i sa bon 'byin par byed pa yin pas na /
analyzed: pa'i sa bon 'byin par byed pa yin pas na /
translated: Here, when the wisdom that does not observe the sameness of all phenomena and the sameness of the nature of all sentient beings arises, in order, the nonobserving wisdom, compassion, and the mind of enlightenment, which has the characteristics of both of these, is the essence of wisdom, and because it eliminates the seeds of conceptuality,

original: nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pa yin te /
translated: it conquers the afflictions.

original: de ni bha ga'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de ni bha ga'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: That is the reality of the bhaga.

original: phyag rgya'i gzugs ltar na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te de ni 'dir phyag rgyar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i gzugs ltar na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te de ni 'dir phyag rgyar byas pa yin no //
translated: The form of the seal is the moon disk, which is the seal here.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor de'i don te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor de'i don te /
translated: It is the meaning of the mandala because it is the sameness of all phenomena, the sameness of all sentient beings, and the perfection of all virtuous qualities.

original: dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi tshul yang dag pa'i snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi tshul yang dag pa'i snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i don yin no //
translated: It is the meaning of the nature of the light of the correct appearance of the method of the gnosis of the object.

original: ling+ga'i phyag rgya'i gzugs kyang mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi yin par gsungs la /
analyzed: ling+ga'i phyag rgya'i gzugs kyang mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi yin par gsungs la /
translated: The form of the seal of the liṅga is also said to be the four signs.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni mdor na byang chub kyi spyod pa ma lus pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin pas /
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni mdor na byang chub kyi spyod pa ma lus pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin pas /
translated: Its reality is, in brief, the conformity with all the practices of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems brtan par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems brtan par gyur pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the bodhicitta becomes stable.

original: de ba stan pa ni rang gi sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ba stan pa ni rang gi sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The teaching of that is stated in “one’s mind itself is perfect buddhahood” and so on.

original: rang gi sems nyid rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: One’s mind itself is perfect buddhahood.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems nyid kyis shes bya thams cad yang dag par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems nyid kyis shes bya thams cad yang dag par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the enlightenment mind itself is the correct realization of all objects of knowledge.

original: des na de nyid rtogs par bya ba yang yin te /
analyzed: des na de nyid rtogs par bya ba yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is also that which is to be realized,

original: de nyid kyis shes bya thams cad bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis shes bya thams cad bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it itself includes all objects of knowledge.

original: gsad bya ba zhes bya ba ni gsad pa dang 'gog pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: gsad bya ba zhes bya ba ni gsad pa dang 'gog pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
translated: “That which is to be killed” is a synonym for “that which is to be killed, stopped, extinguished, abandoned, and eliminated.”

original: rang gi sems nyid gzung ste sgrib pa'i sa bon thams cad dgag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid gzung ste sgrib pa'i sa bon thams cad dgag pa yin gyi /
translated: One’s own mind itself is to be apprehended and all the seeds of obscurations are to be stopped.

original: thams cad du chad pa ni ma yin no //🔽sems nyid ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bar bshad de sgrib pa rnams nges par 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: thams cad du chad pa ni ma yin no // sems nyid ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bar bshad de sgrib pa rnams nges par 'gog par byed do //
translated: But it is not the case that everything is to be stopped.🔽The mind itself is explained as the enlightenment mind, which definitely stops the obscurations.

original: de lta bu'i ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis na 'tshang rgya ba 'di byang chub kyi sems nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis na 'tshang rgya ba 'di byang chub kyi sems nyid yin no //
translated: This enlightenment, which has the characteristics of the perfection of such wisdom and abandonment, is the enlightenment mind itself.

original: de ltar spyod pa yongs su bsdus pa ni ling+ga'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa yongs su bsdus pa ni ling+ga'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: Thus, the reality of the liṅga is the summary of the conduct.

original: de ltar rjes su dran pa gnyis kyis bha ga dang ling+ga bshad pa yin te lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dran pa gnyis kyis bha ga dang ling+ga bshad pa yin te lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: Thus, the bhaga and the liṅga are explained by the two recollections. The rest is easy to understand.

original: de la sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu sbyor ba mdor bsdus nas ba stan pa yin la /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu sbyor ba mdor bsdus nas ba stan pa yin la /
translated: Therein, the cause and effect of the recollection of the Buddha is taught in brief.

original: de byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rdo rje dang zla ba nyid kyi rim gyis so //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rdo rje dang zla ba nyid kyi rim gyis so //
translated: That is by the stages of the vajra and moon of the bodhisattva and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ni rnam @127b pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ni rnam @127b pa lnga ste /
translated: For the tathāgatas, it is fivefold.

original: zla ba la zla ba dang / rdo rje la rdo rje dang sku ste /
analyzed: zla ba la zla ba dang / rdo rje la rdo rje dang sku ste /
translated: The moon is the moon, the vajra is the vajra, and the body is the body.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The body of the Buddha is the fifth.

original: bsgom pa 'di dang ci 'dod par bzlas pa'i rang bzhin grub pa'i sngags lnga po dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa dang rdo rje rtse mo dang zla gsang thig le dang gsang ba'i mdzod las rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa 'di dang ci 'dod par bzlas pa'i rang bzhin grub pa'i sngags lnga po dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa dang rdo rje rtse mo dang zla gsang thig le dang gsang ba'i mdzod las rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This meditation and the mantra accomplishment of the nature of whatever is desired are taught extensively in the Śrī Guhyasamāja, the Vajraśekhara, the Candrasamajottara, and the Guhyakośa.

original: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu yang zla gsang thig le dang gsang ba'i mdzod dag las gsungs pas de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu yang zla gsang thig le dang gsang ba'i mdzod dag las gsungs pas de brjod par bya ste /
translated: The result of meditation is also taught in the Candragarbha-tilaka and the Guhyakośa, so it will be discussed here.

original: de nas bsam gtan gyi phyag rgyas gnas la /
analyzed: de nas bsam gtan gyi phyag rgyas gnas la /
translated: Then, abiding in the mudra of concentration,

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mnyam nyid bsam par bya /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mnyam nyid bsam par bya /
translated: one should contemplate the sameness of the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: phyi dang nang du bcas pa 'di dag thams cad ni sems dang sems las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi dang nang du bcas pa 'di dag thams cad ni sems dang sems las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: All of these, both outer and inner, are mind and mental factors.🔽There is nothing else that is separate from mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba las tha dad pa gzhan dag yod pa ma yin no zhes yid la nges par bsams la chos thams cad ni gdod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba las tha dad pa gzhan dag yod pa ma yin no zhes yid la nges par bsams la chos thams cad ni gdod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Having ascertained that in the mind, one should think, “All phenomena are primordially unborn.

original: skye ba med cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid yin no zhes yid la brjod do //
analyzed: skye ba med cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid yin no zhes yid la brjod do //
translated: Therefore, they are nonarising and naturally luminous.”

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid kyis na gnyis su med cing stong pa nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid du de bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid kyis na gnyis su med cing stong pa nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid du de bsam par bya'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are selfless, one should contemplate their sameness in being nondual and empty.

original: ji ltar bsam par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one contemplate?

original: chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i sems brtan par byas la /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i sems brtan par byas la /
translated: Having stabilized the mind observing all phenomena,

original: de rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas bsdus pa'i bye brag tha dad pa bsal nas gnyis su med pa'i stong pa nyid du snang ba'i bdag nyid can sdig pa med par mthong ba 'di ni de rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes mthong ba
analyzed: de rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas bsdus pa'i bye brag tha dad pa bsal nas gnyis su med pa'i stong pa nyid du snang ba'i bdag nyid can sdig pa med par mthong ba 'di ni de rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes mthong ba
translated: having eliminated the various distinctions subsumed by the aspects of apprehended object and apprehending subject of those, seeing them as the nature of the appearance of nondual emptiness, free of sin, is the seeing of the nondual wisdom of those.

original: yin te / de la dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: yin te / de la dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: That which is observed is the nature of complete perfection in the manner of nonobservation.

original: 'di'i rab tu sbyor ba ni yang dag pa nyid la rab tu blta ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rab tu sbyor ba ni yang dag pa nyid la rab tu blta ba'o //
translated: The application of that is the correct view.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid du nges pa yin pas de ba stan pa ni thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid du nges pa yin pas de ba stan pa ni thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Since its nature is ascertained as nonerroneous, the teaching of that is stated by “all” and so on.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa'i phyi dang nang gi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa'i phyi dang nang gi dmigs pa'o //
translated: “This” refers to the outer and inner objects of observation of the samādhi.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid kyis so sor snang zhing sems kyis brtags pa rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid kyis so sor snang zhing sems kyis brtags pa rnams so //
translated: “Everything” refers to the individual appearances of the apprehended and the apprehender, which are imagined by the mind.

original: de ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis po 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu brtags pa ste /🔽yang dag @128a * //
analyzed: de ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis po 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu brtags pa ste / yang dag @128a * //
translated: Thus, these two, the apprehended and the apprehender, are the false imagination.🔽The mind itself, which is the false imagination, is the dependent nature.

original: pa ma yin pa kun du  brtags pa'i sems nyid ni kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang dag ba stan par gyur pa las /
analyzed: pa ma yin pa kun du  brtags pa'i sems nyid ni kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang dag ba stan par gyur pa las /
translated: From the dependent nature, which is the false imagination, the imagined nature is taught.

original: yang dag par so sor rtog pa mthong ba ni go rims bzhin du med pa dang / med bzhin du snang ba nyid kyis na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis su med pa'i stong pa rnam par shes pa tsam nyid de /
analyzed: yang dag par so sor rtog pa mthong ba ni go rims bzhin du med pa dang / med bzhin du snang ba nyid kyis na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis su med pa'i stong pa rnam par shes pa tsam nyid de /
translated: The seeing of correct analytical discrimination is, in order, the emptiness of the non-existence of the duality of the imagined nature and the appearance of that non-existent duality in the dependent nature.

original: de'i yang dag par so sor rtog par ba stan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yang dag par so sor rtog par ba stan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that correct analytical discrimination,

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The non-existence of things,” and so on.

original: sems ni rnam par shes pa ste de las tha dad cing lhag pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gzhan dag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems ni rnam par shes pa ste de las tha dad cing lhag pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gzhan dag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Mind is consciousness. Apart from that, there are no other apprehended objects or apprehending subjects.

original: gnyis pos stong pa'i rnam par shes pa ni don dam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis pos stong pa'i rnam par shes pa ni don dam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that consciousness, which is empty of duality, is the ultimate.

original: de ltar yid kyis brjod ces bya ba nges par byas nas so //
analyzed: de ltar yid kyis brjod ces bya ba nges par byas nas so //
translated: Having thus ascertained that it is expressed by the mind,

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: by what?

original: yid kyis te yid kyis brjod nas de'o 'og tu bsam par bya'o zhes snga ma dang spyar ro //
analyzed: yid kyis te yid kyis brjod nas de'o 'og tu bsam par bya'o zhes snga ma dang spyar ro //
translated: By the mind, that is, having been expressed by the mind, it is to be contemplated later.

original: mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i rjes la mnyam pa nyid du nges par bya bar ba stan pa ni /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i rjes la mnyam pa nyid du nges par bya bar ba stan pa ni /
translated: The instruction on ascertaining equality after seeing equality is

original: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: the verse that begins with “non-arising.”

original: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis skye ba med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis skye ba med pa nyid yin no //
translated: All phenomena are non-arising in the manner of non-duality.

original: de ci lam gyis yongs su sbyangs pas skye ba med pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ci lam gyis yongs su sbyangs pas skye ba med pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is that non-arising due to purification by the path?”

original: de ma yin pa'i phyir gzod nas skye ba med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i phyir gzod nas skye ba med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: because that is not so, it is said, “primordially non-arising.”

original: gnyis po ni rtag tu mnyam pa nyid yin pas na ngo bo nyid des gdod ma nyid nas skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis po ni rtag tu mnyam pa nyid yin pas na ngo bo nyid des gdod ma nyid nas skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the two are always the same, the meaning is that by its very nature it is primordially unborn.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis de kho na nyid ces bshad cing dri ma med ces bshad pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis de kho na nyid ces bshad cing dri ma med ces bshad pas /
translated: The phrase “naturally luminous” explains that its nature is reality, and the phrase “stainless” explains that it is free from the stains of the two kinds of conceptualization.

original: gnyis su rtog pa'i dri ma rnams ni rtsa ba mi brtan pa nyid yin pas na glo bur du 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su rtog pa'i dri ma rnams ni rtsa ba mi brtan pa nyid yin pas na glo bur du 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the stains of the two kinds of conceptualization are not firmly rooted, and so they are adventitious.

original: de nas aom tsitta bra ti bidham ka ro mi zhes phra bar bzlas pas dang por zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du blta'o //
analyzed: de nas aom tsitta bra ti bidham ka ro mi zhes phra bar bzlas pas dang por zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du blta'o //
translated: Then, with the subtle recitation of “oṃ cittaprativedham kuruṣvāmī,” first visualize a moon disc.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis na /
translated: Its reality is that it is the basis of the seeds of the afflictions.

original: sngar kun gzhi zhes bshad pa'i sems de'i de yongs su zad pas zag pa med pa'i chos kyi sa bon gyi gzhir gyur pa gnas yongs su gyur pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings gnas med pa bshad pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: sngar kun gzhi zhes bshad pa'i sems de'i de yongs su zad pas zag pa med pa'i chos kyi sa bon gyi gzhir gyur pa gnas yongs su gyur pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings gnas med pa bshad pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Since that mind previously explained as the foundation consciousness is completely exhausted, the transformation of the basis of existence into the foundation of the seeds of uncontaminated phenomena is the uncontaminated realm, the explanation of the nonabiding, the utterly pure.

original: dag pa de nyid ni zla ba'i don @128b yin no //
analyzed: dag pa de nyid ni zla ba'i don @128b yin no //
translated: That purity itself is the meaning of the moon.

original: tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas sangs rgyas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad aa la sogs pa'i gzugs zla ba dang shel lta bur dkar ba'i tshul gyis 'dir rab tu zhugs te /
analyzed: tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas sangs rgyas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad aa la sogs pa'i gzugs zla ba dang shel lta bur dkar ba'i tshul gyis 'dir rab tu zhugs te /
translated: Since the accumulations are perfected, the moon-like forms of a and so on, which are white in the manner of a moon or crystal, enter here in order to become a buddha.
