original: aa a'a ai a'i au a'u ri r'i li l'i ae aee ao aoo aam aa:de'i steng du aom bo dhi tsitta autpa dang y'a mi zhes phra bar bzlas la /
analyzed: aa a'a ai a'i au a'u ri r'i li l'i ae aee ao aoo aam aa:de'i steng du aom bo dhi tsitta autpa dang y'a mi zhes phra bar bzlas la /
translated: A ā i ī u ū ṛ ṝ ḷ ḹ e ai o au aṃ aḥ. On top of that, recite the subtle mantra oṃ bodhicitta utpādayāmi.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Meditate on a second moon maṇḍala.

original: 'dir yang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams ka la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du zhugs te /
analyzed: 'dir yang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams ka la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du zhugs te /
translated: Here also, the qualities of the Buddha enter in the form of the letters ka and so forth in the manner of a reflection.🔽ka kha ga gha ṅa

original: ka kha ga gha dang / tsa tsha dza dha nya /🔽ta tha da dha na /
analyzed: ka kha ga gha dang / tsa tsha dza dha nya / ta tha da dha na /
translated: ca cha ja jha ña

original: ta tha da dha na /
analyzed: ta tha da dha na /
translated: ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa🔽ta tha da dha na

original: pa pha ba bha ma /
analyzed: pa pha ba bha ma /
translated: pa pha ba bha ma

original: ya ra la wa /
analyzed: ya ra la wa /
translated: ya ra la va

original: sha sha sa ha ksha /
analyzed: sha sha sa ha ksha /
translated: śa ṣa sa ha kṣa

original: 'di'i de kho na nyid ni bha ga zhes bshad pa byang chub kyi sems kun du  bzang po'i sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i de kho na nyid ni bha ga zhes bshad pa byang chub kyi sems kun du  bzang po'i sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The reality of this is the bhaga, which is explained as the generation of the mind of enlightenment, the universal good mind.

original: de'i steng du tishtha badzra zhes phra bar bzlas pa las bdag nyid rdo rje dkar po 'od zer dang bcas par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du tishtha badzra zhes phra bar bzlas pa las bdag nyid rdo rje dkar po 'od zer dang bcas par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: On top of that, by the recitation of tiṣṭha vajra, one should meditate on oneself as a white vajra with light rays.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni byang chub kyi spyod pa bsdus pa'i byang chub kyi sems brtan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni byang chub kyi spyod pa bsdus pa'i byang chub kyi sems brtan par gyur pa'o //
translated: The reality of this is the firm generation of the mind of enlightenment that gathers the conduct of enlightenment.

original: de'i 'og tu aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
translated: After that, oṃ vajra ātmāko ’haṃ

original: zhes phra bar bzlas nas rdo rje de nyid las rdo rje dbyings rnams kyis nam mkha' khyab par spro ba dang bsdu ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes phra bar bzlas nas rdo rje de nyid las rdo rje dbyings rnams kyis nam mkha' khyab par spro ba dang bsdu ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having recited that in brief, one should meditate on the emanation and gathering of the vajra-realm pervading space from that very vajra.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni chos kyi sku 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni chos kyi sku 'thob pa'o //
translated: Its reality is the attainment of the dharma-body.

original: de'i 'og tu aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta ta th'a aa ham /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta ta th'a aa ham /
translated: After that, one should recite “Oṃ, I am all tathāgatas” in brief.

original: zhes phra bar bzlas pas zla ba gnyis dang rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: zhes phra bar bzlas pas zla ba gnyis dang rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: From the transformation of the two moons and the vajra,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa sangs rgyas kyi skur bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa sangs rgyas kyi skur bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on the form of the Buddha endowed with all supreme aspects.

original: de'i de kho na nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob pa yin no //
translated: Its reality is the attainment of the gnosis of omniscience endowed with all supreme aspects.

original: de yang rdo rje rtse mo las //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje rtse mo las //
translated: Moreover, in the Vajraśekhara Tantra:

original: sku yi gsang ba de bzhin spyod //
analyzed: sku yi gsang ba de bzhin spyod //
translated: The secret of the body is likewise the conduct.

original: spyod yul thugs su chud pa ste //
analyzed: spyod yul thugs su chud pa ste //
translated: The object of activity is the mind.

original: lnga po de dag kun gyi spyi //
analyzed: lnga po de dag kun gyi spyi //
translated: Those five are the general

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pad gnyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pad gnyid //
translated: of all buddhas.

original: mngon par byang chub rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub rnam pa lnga //
translated: The five aspects of manifest enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas ye shes bla na med ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes bla na med ;
translated: The unsurpassed pristine consciousness of buddhahood.

original: / ces gsungs pa dang / dpal mchog dang po las kyang /
analyzed: / ces gsungs pa dang / dpal mchog dang po las kyang /
translated: And in the Shri Paramiva Tantra:

original: de bzhin du mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid ni /🔽rang sems so sor rtog pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid ni / rang sems so sor rtog pa las /
translated: Likewise, the characteristics of manifest enlightenment🔽are the supreme mind of enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems mchog rdo rje nyid //
analyzed: byang chub sems mchog rdo rje nyid //
translated: the vajra itself,

original: de nyid de yi sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: de nyid de yi sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: and that itself is buddhahood.

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas bsgom pas so //🔽zhes @129a * //🔽gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas bsgom pas so // zhes @129a * // gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Meditate on the buddhahood of self.

original: de ltar na dang po'i rnam pa bzhi ni rgyu'i de kho na nyid la lnga po ni 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dang po'i rnam pa bzhi ni rgyu'i de kho na nyid la lnga po ni 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the first four aspects are the suchness of the cause, and the fifth is the suchness of the result.

original: dris pa / 'bras bu ni rgyu la rag las pa yin pas na rgyu'i sbyor ba nyid bya'i 'bras bu'i sbyor bas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: dris pa / 'bras bu ni rgyu la rag las pa yin pas na rgyu'i sbyor ba nyid bya'i 'bras bu'i sbyor bas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Question: Since the result depends on the cause, one should practice the cause; what is the use of practicing the result?

original: de'i phyir sbyor dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the practice, and so on.”

original: sbyor ba nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor du gyur pa nyid de /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor du gyur pa nyid de /
translated: The practice is the yoga of the buddhas.

original: de dang gang yang dag par 'brel pa med par ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud las kyang dngos po 'byung bar ma gsungs te /
analyzed: de dang gang yang dag par 'brel pa med par ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud las kyang dngos po 'byung bar ma gsungs te /
translated: And in the Yoga Tantra, it is not taught that things arise without any connection to that.

original: de yang 'di las byung bas na srid pa ste rgyu'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di las byung bas na srid pa ste rgyu'o //
translated: Moreover, since it arises from this, it is existence, i.e., the cause.

original: dngos po de nyid du 'byung bas na ;🔽srid pa gang du 'byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: dngos po de nyid du 'byung bas na ; srid pa gang du 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: Since that thing arises in reality,

original: zhes bya'o // la las ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // la las ni /
translated: it is said to be “the existence in which one arises.”🔽Some say,

original: srid pa ru ni 'byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: srid pa ru ni 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: “it is the existence in which one will arise.”

original: zhes zer te gnyis ka yang rnal 'byor rgyud gang du yang rgyu'i sbyor ba 'ba' zhig las 'byung ba ma yin zhes ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes zer te gnyis ka yang rnal 'byor rgyud gang du yang rgyu'i sbyor ba 'ba' zhig las 'byung ba ma yin zhes ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Both of these show that in the Yoga Tantra, one does not arise from the mere application of a cause.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: Well then, how does one arise?

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning “When” and so forth is stated.

original: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas su gyur par sgom pa'i bsgom pa bzhin pa la bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi tshul dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas su gyur par sgom pa'i bsgom pa bzhin pa la bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi tshul dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one meditates on oneself as having the nature of a Buddha, one is a Buddha.

original: ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: How does one meditate?

original: sangs rgyas bdag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bdag ces bya ba ste /
translated: “I am a Buddha.”

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas yin no zhes ba stan pa'i nges pa bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas yin no zhes ba stan pa'i nges pa bsgom pa ste /
translated: The meditation on the certainty of the teaching that I myself am a Buddha is the yoga of the result.

original: de'i tshe ni sbyor ldan zhes pa rnal 'byor pa sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni sbyor ldan zhes pa rnal 'byor pa sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: At that time, endowed with yoga means that the yogi becomes a Buddha.

original: de'i tshe rnal 'byor des byang chub sgrub pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnal 'byor des byang chub sgrub pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: At that time, just that yoga is the attainment of enlightenment is the thought.

original: de yang sangs rgyas nyid sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor ni sangs rgyas rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas nyid sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor ni sangs rgyas rnal 'byor te /
translated: Moreover, the yoga of the attainment of Buddhahood is the yoga of the Buddha.

original: gang yang rgyu'i rnal 'byor nyid kyis 'tshang rgya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul dang bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa las bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang rgyu'i rnal 'byor nyid kyis 'tshang rgya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul dang bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa las bshad pa ste /
translated: The attainment of Buddhahood by the yoga of the cause is explained in the Perfection Vehicle and in the Action Tantra, etc.

original: de ni dus shin tu ring bas 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni dus shin tu ring bas 'byung ba yin no //
translated: That is the attainment of Buddhahood after a very long time.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnams su ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sbyor ba la sogs pas theg pa chen po mtha' dag bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir shin tu myur ba nyid du byang chub thob pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnams su ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sbyor ba la sogs pas theg pa chen po mtha' dag bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir shin tu myur ba nyid du byang chub thob pa yin no //
translated: In the Yoga Tantras, all of the Great Vehicle is included by the yoga of cause and effect, etc., and so enlightenment is attained very quickly.

original: de bas na ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “called samādhi,” and so on.

original: mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba dus mdor bsdus pas 'tshang rgya ba gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin ye shes las byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba dus mdor bsdus pas 'tshang rgya ba gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin ye shes las byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is called “in brief” is the enlightenment that occurs in a brief time. That is called “arisen from the wisdom of samādhi.”

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Samādhi is the samādhi of the five manifest enlightenments.

original: ye @129b shes ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te de gnyis las 'di yang dag par byung zhing skyes pa yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ye @129b shes ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te de gnyis las 'di yang dag par byung zhing skyes pa yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Wisdom is nondual wisdom. Since this arises and is born from those two, it is called that.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te de'i phyir ro zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te de'i phyir ro zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: “ Because” means “for what reason,” and “therefore” should be understood.

original: sangs rgyas rnal 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnal 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar bsdus pa yin te /
translated: “ The yoga of the buddhas” and so on is the summary.

original: gang 'di dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa las /
analyzed: gang 'di dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa las /
translated: In this, in the Śrī-Sahajavajra, it is said:

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin //🔽sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid yin //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin // sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid yin //
translated: The samādhi of Vajrasattva🔽is the dharmatā of the buddhas.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: This is the buddhahood of the buddhas.

original: gzhan du sangs rgyas 'gyur ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du sangs rgyas 'gyur ma yin // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One does not become a Buddha in any other way.

original: de'i don gang yin zhe na //
analyzed: de'i don gang yin zhe na //
translated: What is the meaning of that?

original: don 'di yin te mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim gyis ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgoms la phyis rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis yun ring du gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: don 'di yin te mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim gyis ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgoms la phyis rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis yun ring du gnas par bya ste /
translated: The meaning is this: Having cultivated the three meditative concentrations by the process of the fivefold manifest enlightenment, one should abide for a long time in the meditative concentration of Vajrasattva.

original: rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje la sems mnyam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje la sems mnyam par gzhag nas /
translated: Having settled the mind on the vajra located in one's heart,

original: ji srid 'dod kyi bar du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji srid 'dod kyi bar du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one should abide for as long as one wishes. This is the meaning.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sbyor ba ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sbyor ba ba stan pa'o //
translated: The application of cause and effect has been explained.

original: 'bras bu'i sbyor ba la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa de la yang dag par zhugs pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang / ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sbyor ba la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa de la yang dag par zhugs pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang / ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: As for the application of the effect, it is said, one who has entered into reality. Therein, one who has entered into reality is nondual intuition and intrinsic intuition.

original: de las gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate nondual intuition from that,🔽it is said:

original: phra mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: phra mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The “subtle” and so forth are stated.

original: rang gi sems nyid chos thams cad dmigs pa na spros pa'i mtshan ma thams cad nub par gyur pas gnyis su med par snang ba'i bdag nyid kyis /
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid chos thams cad dmigs pa na spros pa'i mtshan ma thams cad nub par gyur pas gnyis su med par snang ba'i bdag nyid kyis /
translated: When one’s own mind is observed in all phenomena, all signs of conceptual elaborations subside, and with the identity of the appearance of nonduality,

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang sems las byung ba ro gcig par gyur pa gang yin pa de ;
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang sems las byung ba ro gcig par gyur pa gang yin pa de ;
translated: that which is of one taste with the mind and mental factors of all sentient beings

original: dag pa'i bdag nyid gang gis ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ni dang po mthong ba ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i bdag nyid gang gis ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ni dang po mthong ba ste /
translated: is the pure identity that is seen just as it is. That is the first seeing.

original: de'i 'og tu rang gi sems de stug par gyur pa ste zla ba dang rdo rje dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rang gi sems de stug par gyur pa ste zla ba dang rdo rje dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, one’s own mind becomes dense, and it becomes just like the entity of the moon, vajra, buddha, and so on.

original: de dag kyang gang las she na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang las she na /
translated: From what are those?

original: dngos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The “entity” and so on are stated.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i khyad par du bsgom pa de la chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i phra bar gyur ba ni dngos po med pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i khyad par du bsgom pa de la chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i phra bar gyur ba ni dngos po med pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Because of the distinction of entity and non-entity, the meditation on that is subtle in terms of observing all phenomena, and is the distinction of non-entity.

original: phra bar gyur pa de'i 'og tu stug por gyur pa ni dngos po'i khyad par te de lta bu'i dngos po @130a * //
analyzed: phra bar gyur pa de'i 'og tu stug por gyur pa ni dngos po'i khyad par te de lta bu'i dngos po @130a * //
translated: After that subtlety, the dense is the distinction of entity, and such an entity

original: dang ; dngos po med pa'i khyad par sgom pa kun du  brtags pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dang ; dngos po med pa'i khyad par sgom pa kun du  brtags pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and non-entity distinction is imagined meditation.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnams su bsgom pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnams su bsgom pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of meditation in the Yoga Tantras.

original: de dag kyang gang las she na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang las she na /
translated: And from what are they?

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “entity, etc.”

original: dngos po 'ba' zhig ni bsgom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po 'ba' zhig ni bsgom pa ma yin te /
translated: Entity alone is not meditation.

original: rnam pa bzhi po la sangs rgyas kyi sku skyes pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po la sangs rgyas kyi sku skyes pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though the Buddha’s form is born in the four aspects,

original: rang bzhin gyi sku las shin tu dman pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni phra ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sku las shin tu dman pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni phra ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: it is a subtle entity, because it is very inferior to the natural body.

original: sgom pa de yang bsgom pa ma yin te bsgoms kyang bsgom pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: sgom pa de yang bsgom pa ma yin te bsgoms kyang bsgom pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: That meditation is also not meditation, because even though it is meditated, it is not meditation.

original: ji ltar sgom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sgom pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it meditation?

original: des don dam pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des don dam pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it sees the ultimate.

original: ji ltar bsgom pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not meditation?

original: mngon par byang chub pa lnga bsgoms pa'i 'og tu shin tu gyur bar byang chub 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa lnga bsgoms pa'i 'og tu shin tu gyur bar byang chub 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because after meditating on the five manifest enlightenments, one attains the enlightenment of complete transformation.

original: de nas ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de nas ci zhig ce na /
translated: Then what?

original: bsgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “meditation,” etc.

original: phra ba'i dngos po bsgoms pas ni don dam pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra ba'i dngos po bsgoms pas ni don dam pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by meditating on the subtle entity, one sees the ultimate.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i dngos po sgom pa ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i dngos po sgom pa ste /
translated: Then after that, one meditates on the entity of the moon, vajra, etc.

original: dngos po de bsgoms pas rang gi sems yongs su spyang ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po de bsgoms pas rang gi sems yongs su spyang ba ste /
translated: By meditating on that entity, one purifies one’s mind.

original: yongs su dag pa'i las dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i las dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: That is the stage of the purification of the pure action.

original: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rang gi sems nyid las gzhan ma yin no zhes nges par byas pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rang gi sems nyid las gzhan ma yin no zhes nges par byas pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Therefore, one should ascertain that cause and effect are nothing other than one’s own mind. That is nondual wisdom.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu rang gi sems nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu rang gi sems nyid yin na /
translated: If cause and effect are one’s own mind,

original: de'i tshe de nyid ni de'i rig pa yin pas rnal 'byor pa de sangs rgyas par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid ni de'i rig pa yin pas rnal 'byor pa de sangs rgyas par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: then since that is the cognition of that, the yogi would not become a buddha.

original: de thams cad mkhyen na bdag nyid dang gdul bya rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa mi shes pas ji ltar sangs rgyas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de thams cad mkhyen na bdag nyid dang gdul bya rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa mi shes pas ji ltar sangs rgyas pa yin zhe na /
translated: If he were omniscient, he would not know the mental activity of himself and those to be tamed. How could he be a buddha?

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Buddhahood is not an object of knowledge,” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas te thams cad mkhyen pa ni yul ma yin zhing gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas na sangs rgyas kyi yul lo ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas te thams cad mkhyen pa ni yul ma yin zhing gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas na sangs rgyas kyi yul lo ;
translated: Buddhahood, omniscience, is not an object of knowledge, not something to be apprehended, and therefore it is the object of buddhas.

original: / sems can ni gdul bya rnams te de rnams ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: / sems can ni gdul bya rnams te de rnams ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Sentient beings are those to be tamed, and they are not objects to be apprehended.

original: gal te de gzung bar gyur na ni de'i tshe de la gnyis kyi rtog pa yod pas 'khrul bar 'gyur gyi 'tshang rgya bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de gzung bar gyur na ni de'i tshe de la gnyis kyi rtog pa yod pas 'khrul bar 'gyur gyi 'tshang rgya bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were apprehended, then at that time, since there would be the conception of duality in that, there would be error, and there would be no enlightenment.

original: 'o na ji ltar sangs rgyas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sangs rgyas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, how would there be Buddhahood?

original: rang @130b gi sems rtogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang @130b gi sems rtogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “By realizing one’s own mind, etc. ”

original: rang gi sems nyid kyi chos thams cad ro gcig pra rtogs pas rang rig pa tsam gyi 'khrul pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid kyi chos thams cad ro gcig pra rtogs pas rang rig pa tsam gyi 'khrul pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By realizing that all phenomena are of one taste in one’s own mind, one is free from the error of mere self-awareness.

original: sangs rgyas te zhes bya ba ni byang chub cing thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas te zhes bya ba ni byang chub cing thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: “Buddhahood” means enlightenment and omniscience.

original: nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir gnyis med sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir gnyis med sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to summarize, it is said, “The union of nonduality, etc. ”

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la mnyam par gzhag pa'i ni gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la mnyam par gzhag pa'i ni gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The union of nondual wisdom is the union of nonduality.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni 'bras bu'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni 'bras bu'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Samādhi is the resultant union.

original: de'i ye shes ni yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: Its wisdom is thorough knowledge.

original: de kho na nyid nges par brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid nges par brtag pa'o //
translated: That is the analysis of reality.

original: de'i don brtag pa ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don brtag pa ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is “examination,” which is “production.”

original: rgyu'i de nyid ji ltar zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid mthong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i de nyid ji ltar zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid mthong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: “ How is the suchness of the cause?” is the vision of the nature of the completely pure mind.

original: de nyid yin zhes bya ba ni mthong ba zhes bya ba dang spyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid yin zhes bya ba ni mthong ba zhes bya ba dang spyar ro //
translated: “ That itself” is to be connected with “vision.”

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ba stan pa'o //
translated: The nondual intuition is taught.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the intuition of reality,

original: rgyu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “cause” and so on.

original: rgyu ni zla ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni zla ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause is the moon and so on.

original: 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas kyi sku la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas kyi sku la sogs pa ste /
translated: The effect is the buddha body and so on.

original: de gnyis la ni de kho na nyid cung zad kyang med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis la ni de kho na nyid cung zad kyang med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because neither of those two has even the slightest reality.

original: med pa nyid ni gcig dang du ma dang du ma bral ba yin no //
analyzed: med pa nyid ni gcig dang du ma dang du ma bral ba yin no //
translated: Nonexistence is free from one and many.

original: de yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: And that is stated in the noble Descent into Laṅkā:

original: ji ltar me long ngag la gzugs //
analyzed: ji ltar me long ngag la gzugs //
translated: Just as a reflection in a mirror

original: gcig dang du ma rnam spangs par /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma rnam spangs par /
translated: is free from one and many,

original: snang yang de la yod ma yin //
analyzed: snang yang de la yod ma yin //
translated: appears but does not exist there,🔽so too is the world.

original: de bzhin dngos la dngos rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos la dngos rnams so //
translated: Likewise, things are things in reality.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: rgyu nyid ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nyid ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The cause itself is the nature of the cause.🔽That itself is just that

original: de nyid de ni de bzhin zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du ste don dam par ro //
analyzed: de nyid de ni de bzhin zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du ste don dam par ro //
translated: means in reality, in the ultimate sense.🔽In that wisdom

original: ye shes de la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes de la'o //
analyzed: ye shes de la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes de la'o //
translated: means in that wisdom of reality.🔽It is practiced

original: kun du spyod ces bya ba ni yang dag par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: kun du spyod ces bya ba ni yang dag par spyod pa'o //
translated: means it is correctly practiced.

original: ji ltar yang dag par spyod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par spyod ce na /
translated: How is it correctly practiced?🔽It is said,

original: rgyu yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: by the cause, etc.

original: de yang gnyis pos stong pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de yang gnyis pos stong pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Moreover, consciousness, which is empty of duality, is the perfected nature.🔽In that unmistaken wisdom, the imagined nature and the dependent nature are known.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes de la kun brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin can gyi yongs su shes par 'gyur pa de la ni rgyu la rgyu'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin la 'bras bu la 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bor @131a * //🔽yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes de la kun brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin can gyi yongs su shes par 'gyur pa de la ni rgyu la rgyu'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin la 'bras bu la 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bor @131a * //🔽yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In that, the cause does not exist as the nature of the cause in the effect, and the effect does not exist as its own nature in the cause.

original: brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i brdzun par nges pa'i yongs su shes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du gzung bar byar med pas so //
analyzed: brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i brdzun par nges pa'i yongs su shes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du gzung bar byar med pas so //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the ascertained falsity of the imagined nature is the cause of the thorough knowledge of the dependent nature.

original: de ltar na med pa las de 'dzin pa nyid du rang gi sems snang ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na med pa las de 'dzin pa nyid du rang gi sems snang ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the apprehension of what does not exist is the appearance of one’s own mind.

original: so sor snang ba gnyis ka med pa'i shes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du yongs su shes pa yin te /
analyzed: so sor snang ba gnyis ka med pa'i shes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du yongs su shes pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge that the two appearances do not exist is the thorough knowledge of the dependent nature.

original: de bas na 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa tsam nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa tsam nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, these are consciousness only.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis ni stong pa nyid yin no zhes gang yongs su shes pa de ni de'i phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis ni stong pa nyid yin no zhes gang yongs su shes pa de ni de'i phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: the thorough knowledge of the emptiness of both cause and effect is the nonerroneous thorough knowledge of that.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: It is the wisdom of reality.

original: de ltar med pa yin na ji ltar zla ba la sogs par rang nyid mi snang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar med pa yin na ji ltar zla ba la sogs par rang nyid mi snang zhe na /
translated: If they do not exist in that way, why do they not appear as the moon, etc.?

original: med pa ni snang ba'i gzugs dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni snang ba'i gzugs dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are devoid of the form of appearance.

original: rang nyid so sor snang bar gyur pa de la ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang nyid so sor snang bar gyur pa de la ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: That which appears as separate does not have any connection with it.

original: rgyu 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it has no cause at all.

original: de bas na so sor snang ba de la nam yang ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na so sor snang ba de la nam yang ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that which appears as separate never exists as anything at all.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has no cause.

original: 'o na sems ji ltar med pa'i tshul gyis snang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sems ji ltar med pa'i tshul gyis snang zhe na /
translated: How then does mind appear as if it does not exist?

original: gang gi phyir snang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sems de ni gzugs su 'khrul cing gzugs las gzhan na med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sems de ni gzugs su 'khrul cing gzugs las gzhan na med pa yin te /
translated: Because that mind which has the nature of appearance is mistaken as form and does not exist apart from form.

original: de bas na gzugs de ni gzugs las gyur pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs de ni gzugs las gyur pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, that form is not transformed from form.

original: de gzugs med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de gzugs med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it formless.

original: sems snang ba'i tshul yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid dang de las gzhan par snang ba'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems snang ba'i tshul yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid dang de las gzhan par snang ba'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is the mode of appearance of mind, it is not connected with appearance as its nature or as something other than that.

original: de bas na snang ba nyid du yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na snang ba nyid du yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it does not exist even as appearance.

original: shes pa las don gzhan shes pa'am gzugs su 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: shes pa las don gzhan shes pa'am gzugs su 'khrul pa med de /
translated: Apart from consciousness, there is no consciousness mistaken as form.

original: nyams su myong bar grub pa ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong bar grub pa ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The experience of the object is the error.

original: de yang sems nyid gzugs su 'khrul pas snang ba dang snang ba ma yin pa'i 'khrul pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sems nyid gzugs su 'khrul pas snang ba dang snang ba ma yin pa'i 'khrul pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And that is the error of the mind itself in the form of the appearance of the object and the appearance of the non-object.

original: de bas na gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo ltar gzugs su 'khrul par gyur pa'i rjes su myong bar grub pas snang ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo ltar gzugs su 'khrul par gyur pa'i rjes su myong bar grub pas snang ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the object is an appearance because it is experienced as the error of the form of the object, just like the form of the object.

original: de la yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu med pas 'gal ba nyid du 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: de la yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu med pas 'gal ba nyid du 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: And that is the error of contradiction because it has no cause of existence or non-existence.

original: nges pa de yang rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa la zhen pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa tsam yin la /
analyzed: nges pa de yang rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa la zhen pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa tsam yin la /
translated: And that determination is mere conceptualization because it arises from the latent impressions of the attachment to conceptualization that is in accord with one’s own class.

original: de bas na mngon par zhen pa rnam par dag @131b pa'i yang dag pa la so sor rtog pa legs par bsgoms pa'i rim gyis yang dag pa'i ye shes skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par zhen pa rnam par dag @131b pa'i yang dag pa la so sor rtog pa legs par bsgoms pa'i rim gyis yang dag pa'i ye shes skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the arising of the correct pristine consciousness is the process of cultivating well the discernment of the correct reality that is the purification of the attachment.

original: de bas na 'khrul pa nyid du grub pa 'di dag nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul pa nyid du grub pa 'di dag nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these determinations are established as mere errors.

original: de yang 'di ltar de'i bdag nyid du 'khrul pa las kyang so sor snang ba 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar de'i bdag nyid du 'khrul pa las kyang so sor snang ba 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is contradictory that the appearance of the object is separate from the error of its being of the nature of that,

original: rgyu yang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu yang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause is of the nature of that.

original: de ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /🔽byis pas ji ltar rnam brtags bzhin //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang / byis pas ji ltar rnam brtags bzhin //
translated: This is also stated in the noble Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra:

original: phyi rol don ni yod min te //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni yod min te //
translated: “The external object does not exist as it is imagined by the childish.

original: bag chags kyis ni bsgos pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni bsgos pa'i sems //
translated: The mind is colored by habitual tendencies.

original: rang gi sems ni phyi rol snang //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin te /🔽bsgom pa ni bcom pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni phyi rol snang // zhes gsungs pa yin te / bsgom pa ni bcom pa'o //
translated: One’s own mind appears as external.”🔽The cultivation of the realization of the objectless is the cultivation of the realization of the objectless.

original: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang yongs su shes pa de las ni de bzhin yongs su she la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang yongs su shes pa de las ni de bzhin yongs su she la /
translated: The realization of the imagined and the dependent is the realization of the perfected.

original: de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyi chos rnams so //
translated: The perfected is the nature of phenomena.

original: de bas na de shes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de shes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes ba stan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the realization of that is the teaching of the essence of wisdom.

original: dris pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sbyor ba ni yod pa ma yin pa las snang ba'i phyir 'khrul pa yin la gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes kyang shin tu 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: dris pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sbyor ba ni yod pa ma yin pa las snang ba'i phyir 'khrul pa yin la gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes kyang shin tu 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: The question is asked: “The connection between cause and effect is an illusion because it appears from what does not exist.

original: brjod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: brjod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin na /
translated: The pristine wisdom of the nondual nature is also a great illusion because it is expressed. If illusion is not reality,

original: ji ltar na 'di dag bsgom pa byang chub kyi lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di dag bsgom pa byang chub kyi lam yin zhe na /
translated: how can these be the path of meditation for enlightenment?”

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste /🔽gang gi phyir chos thams cad la spros pa med pa'i ye shes dang po skyes pas chos kyi dbyings kun du  'gro ba dang kun du  rtog pa dang de'i stobs kyis ye shes 'di dag dus dang rnam par dbye bas ji lta bas nye
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste / gang gi phyir chos thams cad la spros pa med pa'i ye shes dang po skyes pas chos kyi dbyings kun du  'gro ba dang kun du  rtog pa dang de'i stobs kyis ye shes 'di dag dus dang rnam par dbye bas ji lta bas nye
translated: Here it is said:🔽“Because the pristine wisdom of the nonconceptual nature of all phenomena arises first, the all-pervading expanse of reality and the conceptual mind are inseparable.

original: bar mtshon pa'i khyad par rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar mtshon pa'i khyad par rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: By the power of that, these pristine wisdoms arise as the distinctions of time and aspect.

original: de nas de bzhin nyid yongs su gcod par byed pa rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad na rab rib can gyis nam mkha' la skra shad mthong ba lta bus ji ltar brjod pa med pa yongs su spyod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin nyid yongs su gcod par byed pa rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad na rab rib can gyis nam mkha' la skra shad mthong ba lta bus ji ltar brjod pa med pa yongs su spyod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, if the characteristic of consciousness, which determines suchness, is explained, then how can one who is like a person with an eye disease seeing floating hairs in space enjoy the inexpressible?

original: so sor rig par gyur pa la shin tu byang bar gyur pa rang gi lus la sogs pa rjes su myong ste /
analyzed: so sor rig par gyur pa la shin tu byang bar gyur pa rang gi lus la sogs pa rjes su myong ste /
translated: One who has become very skilled in the discernment of the individual experiences one’s own body, etc.,

original: brtag pa dang bdag tu yongs su gcod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brtag pa dang bdag tu yongs su gcod pa bzhin no //
translated: just as one imagines and determines a self.

original: rnam par mi rtog par 'jug pa'i gzungs las kyang ji skad du /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la rab tu gnas pas ni shes bya dang khyad par @132a * //🔽med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par 'jug pa'i gzungs las kyang ji skad du / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la rab tu gnas pas ni shes bya dang khyad par @132a * // med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis /
translated: And the Dhāraṇī of Entering Nonconceptuality says,

original: chos thams cad nam mkha'i dkyil dang mtshungs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha'i dkyil dang mtshungs par mthong ngo //
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is well-positioned in the nonconceptual realm sees all phenomena to be like the center of space with a nonconceptual wisdom that is no different from the object of knowledge.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i 'og tu thob pa'i shes pas ni chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang mi g-yor dang brag ca dang gzugs brnyan dang chu zla dang sprul pa dang bar mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i 'og tu thob pa'i shes pas ni chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang mi g-yor dang brag ca dang gzugs brnyan dang chu zla dang sprul pa dang bar mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The knowledge obtained after non-conceptual knowledge sees all dharmas as illusions, mirages, dreams, mirages, echoes, reflections, water-moons, emanations.

original: de bas na dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis de kho na nyid yongs su gcod pa nyid kyis dag pa dang 'khrul pa nyid kyis 'jig rten pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis de kho na nyid yongs su gcod pa nyid kyis dag pa dang 'khrul pa nyid kyis 'jig rten pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, pure mundane knowledge is pure because it determines reality, and mundane because it is deluded.

original: de nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras bu nyid kyis de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras bu nyid kyis de kho na nyid de /
translated: That itself is reality because it is the fruit of supramundane knowledge.

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i chos yongs su nyams pa nyid kyis snga ma'i khyad par 'thob pa las gong ma'i khyad par phul du byung ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i chos yongs su nyams pa nyid kyis snga ma'i khyad par 'thob pa las gong ma'i khyad par phul du byung ste /
translated: These are the distinctions of the superior, obtained from the previous distinctions, by the complete loss of the noble dharmas.

original: de bas na ye shes de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na ye shes de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that this knowledge, etc.

original: rang gi sems de nyid zla ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so sor snang ba ni de kho na nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang gi sems de nyid zla ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so sor snang ba ni de kho na nyid yin te /
translated: The reality of one's own mind appearing individually in the manner of the moon, etc. is reality.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zla ba la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni ma yin te 'di ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zla ba la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni ma yin te 'di ni spyi'i don to //
translated: It is not the reality of the moon, etc. by way of its own nature. This is the general meaning.

original: gong nas gong du phul du byung bar ba stan pa'i phyir de kho na nyid dang / gsang ba dang shin tu gsang ba dang mchog gi sgrar bshad de /
analyzed: gong nas gong du phul du byung bar ba stan pa'i phyir de kho na nyid dang / gsang ba dang shin tu gsang ba dang mchog gi sgrar bshad de /
translated: In order to teach the excellence of the higher and higher, reality is explained by the words reality, secret, very secret, and supreme.

original: 'dir ye shes ni de kho na nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir ye shes ni de kho na nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, intuition is the meaning of the word reality intuition.

original: de la de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pas de las gzhan pa'i de kho na nyid mthong ngam /
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pas de las gzhan pa'i de kho na nyid mthong ngam /
translated: In that regard, does the yogin of reality see another reality?

original: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: Or, does he not?

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He declares, That itself, etc.

original: de kho na nyid dang gsang ba nyid dang / shin tu gsang ba nyid dang / dam pa nyid do zhes bya bar shes te nges par bzung ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyis na shes pa ste rtogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang gsang ba nyid dang / shin tu gsang ba nyid dang / dam pa nyid do zhes bya bar shes te nges par bzung ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyis na shes pa ste rtogs pa'i don to //
translated: The result of ascertainment is knowledge, which means realization.

original: de zhes bya ba ni shes pa de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni shes pa de'o //
translated: That refers to that knowledge.

original: de nyid rtogs pa ni gsang ba'i rnam pa shes shing rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rtogs pa ni gsang ba'i rnam pa shes shing rtogs pa'o //
translated: Realizing that is knowing and realizing the aspect of the secret.

original: 'di dag ni mchog yin no zhes kyang spyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mchog yin no zhes kyang spyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should also be applied as these are supreme.

original: rgyu tsam dang 'bras bu tsam ni rgyu'i sems las 'bras bu'i sems bye brag med pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu tsam dang 'bras bu tsam ni rgyu'i sems las 'bras bu'i sems bye brag med pa yin te /
translated: The mere cause and mere result are the result consciousness not different from the causal consciousness.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba bzhi pa nyid bzhir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba bzhi pa nyid bzhir shes par bya'o //
translated: The fourth, called emptiness, should be known as fourfold.

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i gsum gsum ni sems tsam ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i gsum gsum ni sems tsam ste /
translated: The three that are not different from that are mere mind.

original: de ni thams cad du yod par bshad pas 'di ni nges par chad pa ma @132b yin no //
analyzed: de ni thams cad du yod par bshad pas 'di ni nges par chad pa ma @132b yin no //
translated: Since it is explained as existing everywhere, this is not a definite exclusion.

original: 'bras bu'i de nyid yang dag zhugs //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i de nyid yang dag zhugs //
translated: Engaging the reality of the result,

original: rgyu yi de nyid mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu yi de nyid mi 'dod do //
translated: not desiring the reality of the cause.

original: zhes gsungs pa de yang bshad par bya ba'i phyir sdug pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de yang bshad par bya ba'i phyir sdug pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain that statement, he says, “The yogi/nī who is engaged in the reality of the result should abandon the desire to obtain and reject the pleasant and unpleasant.”

original: thob pa dang sprad pa dag gang sdug pa dang mi sdug par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: thob pa dang sprad pa dag gang sdug pa dang mi sdug par bshad pa ste /
translated: The pleasant and unpleasant are explained as the obtainment and the rejection.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang nyan mongs pa'o //🔽de gnyis ka las rgyal bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang nyan mongs pa'o // de gnyis ka las rgyal bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: They are the pristine wisdom of the Buddha and the afflictions.

original: de bas na 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thob par 'dod pa dang / dor bar 'dod pa spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thob par 'dod pa dang / dor bar 'dod pa spang bar bya ste /
translated: The yogi/nī who is engaged in the reality of the result should abandon the desire to obtain the former and the desire to reject the latter.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rnam par rtog pa ma lus par spangs pa thams cad rtogs pas bdag nyid sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar mngon sum nyid du nges par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rnam par rtog pa ma lus par spangs pa thams cad rtogs pas bdag nyid sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar mngon sum nyid du nges par bya'o //
translated: The yogi/nī should ascertain that by realizing the pristine wisdom of the Buddha, which is the abandonment of all conceptualization, he or she is like the Buddha.

original: de lta na ni 'dir myur bar sangs rgyas par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'dir myur bar sangs rgyas par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that were not so, then one would not quickly become a Buddha here.

original: gzhan dag ni ji tsam du 'bras bu 'dod pa de tsam du rgyu 'dod pa yin pas rgyu bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ji tsam du 'bras bu 'dod pa de tsam du rgyu 'dod pa yin pas rgyu bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Others assert that to the extent one desires the result, one desires the cause, so the cause is to be accomplished.

original: srid pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i bya ba yun ring pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i bya ba yun ring pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Others, to the extent that they desire the result, desire the cause, and so the activity of the succession of existences would be prolonged for the sake of the accomplishment of the cause.

original: 'dod pa med pa nyid du ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa med pa nyid du ba stan pa'o //
translated: The absence of desire is taught:

original: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab pa med par ni rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab pa med par ni rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without the four seals, the yoga is not perfected.

original: de bas na de'i de kho na nyid ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de'i de kho na nyid ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that reality,

original: rnam shes tsam ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam shes tsam ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “consciousness only,” etc.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / brjod pa dang rjod par byed pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam shes tsam zhes bya ste /🔽dngos po gtso bo ma yin pas na rnam par shes pa tsam zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / brjod pa dang rjod par byed pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam shes tsam zhes bya ste / dngos po gtso bo ma yin pas na rnam par shes pa tsam zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Consciousness only is the emptiness of the apprehender and apprehended, the expression and the expressed.🔽Since it is not the principal thing, it is called “consciousness only.”

original: nye bar gdags pas de'i ye shes la yang de skad ces bya'o ;
analyzed: nye bar gdags pas de'i ye shes la yang de skad ces bya'o ;
translated: The meaning is that it is a mere designation.

original: / rnam par shes pa tsam nyid kyis gal te rnal 'byor la dmigs pa yongs su shes pa yin pas de med par ni rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don to //
analyzed: / rnam par shes pa tsam nyid kyis gal te rnal 'byor la dmigs pa yongs su shes pa yin pas de med par ni rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is this: If the yogi’s perception of consciousness-only is complete, then there is no yoga without that.

original: gal te de ltar na rnam par shes pa dag la nyid rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dngos grub yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rnam par shes pa dag la nyid rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dngos grub yin gyi /
translated: If that is so, then the yogi’s spiritual power is in the consciousnesses themselves,

original: blo dag pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: blo dag pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and not in the purity of mind.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse says, “How can there be a pure mind in one who is not a Tathāgata?”

original: ji ltar rnal 'byor pa 'di'i ye shes mchog tu shin tu dag par gyur pa de ltar dag par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa yang @133a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rnal 'byor pa 'di'i ye shes mchog tu shin tu dag par gyur pa de ltar dag par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur te / de bzhin gshegs pa yang @133a * //
translated: The meaning is that just as the yogi’s supreme, pure pristine wisdom becomes, so does the yogi become a Tathāgata.

original: ye shes tsam nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ye shes tsam nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: And the Tathāgata is just pristine wisdom.🔽The verse says, “How can there be a pure mind in one who is not a Tathāgata?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sku yang phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan par rnal 'byor gyi rgyud 'di nyid du bsgom par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sku yang phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan par rnal 'byor gyi rgyud 'di nyid du bsgom par bya ba yin pas /
translated: The body of the Tathagata and so forth are also to be cultivated in this very Yoga Tantra as endowed with the four seals.

original: de'i nye bar sbyor ba ba stan pa'i phyir rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i nye bar sbyor ba ba stan pa'i phyir rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach their application, he says consciousness and so forth.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam zhes bya ba ni dngos po gtso bo ma yin par ba stan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam zhes bya ba ni dngos po gtso bo ma yin par ba stan pa ste /
translated: Consciousness only is taught as the principal thing.

original: nye bar gdags pas ye shes de la yang 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar gdags pas ye shes de la yang 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: By the designation, that intuition is also called this.

original: de nas rnam par shes pa tsam gyi ye shes med pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni rnal 'byor rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas rnam par shes pa tsam gyi ye shes med pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni rnal 'byor rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, the yogi/nī who does not have the intuition of consciousness only will not complete the yoga.

original: yang bdag nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang bdag nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Again, the self is the Tathagata. How so?

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du blta bar bya'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du blta bar bya'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be seen as consciousness only.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: How and so forth is stated.

original: ye shes ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Intuition is correct intuition.

original: mchog ni shin tu dag pa ste dag pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchog ni shin tu dag pa ste dag pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The supreme is the very pure, meaning the ultimate purity.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa tsam gyi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa tsam gyi tshul gyis so //
translated: Thus means in that way, by the method of mere consciousness.

original: dag pa de bzhin gshegs zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i bdag nyid du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dag pa de bzhin gshegs zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i bdag nyid du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The pure is the Tathagata, meaning that one should view it as the nature of reality.

original: des na shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin par bdag nyid la mos la /
analyzed: des na shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin par bdag nyid la mos la /
translated: Therefore, one should have conviction in the nature of the very pure gnosis.

original: de nyid ni phyag rgya rnams kyi don yin par ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ni phyag rgya rnams kyi don yin par ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is the meaning of the seals,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says consciousness, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa tsam du lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa tsam du lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the conviction that it is mere consciousness.

original: phyag rgya nyid ni cho ga'i thabs rnams so //
analyzed: phyag rgya nyid ni cho ga'i thabs rnams so //
translated: The seals are the methods of the rite.

original: de bas na de ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, it is fourfold.

original: gsang ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gsang ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the secret?

original: gsang ba gnyis med sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: gsang ba gnyis med sbyor ba yis //
translated: The secret is the union of the nondual.

original: zhes bya ba ste gnyis su med pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste gnyis su med pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam nyid kyis so //
translated: by the mere consciousness of non-duality itself.

original: gsang ba ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: gsang ba ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the secret like?

original: sku gsung thugs su yang dag 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs su yang dag 'byung // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is the perfect emergence of body, speech, and mind.

original: skur byung ba dang gsung du byung ba dang thugs su byung ba ste /
analyzed: skur byung ba dang gsung du byung ba dang thugs su byung ba ste /
translated: It is the emergence of body, the emergence of speech, and the emergence of mind.

original: sku la sogs pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the object of observation of body, etc.

original: ji ltar na sku la sogs par byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sku la sogs par byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the emergence of body, etc.?🔽It is stated:

original: thugs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽lus dang ngag dang yid kyi ni //
analyzed: thugs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi ni //
translated: By the mind, etc.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid rnam par shes pa tsam du rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du ba stan pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid rnam par shes pa tsam du rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du ba stan pa yin no //
translated: The consciousnesses of body, speech, and mind are taught in order.

original: des na thugs dang @133b sku dang gsung gi dang thams cad 'gro ba yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: des na thugs dang @133b sku dang gsung gi dang thams cad 'gro ba yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the mind, body, and speech of all migrating beings should be understood.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes ba stan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes ba stan pa yin no //
translated: All of this teaches the wisdom of meditative stabilization.

original: de nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize that,

original: rgya yi rgyas btab dngos po ni //
analyzed: rgya yi rgyas btab dngos po ni //
translated: The seal of the seal of the entity

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: is said to be the four seals.

original: gsang ba dag ces bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyi don to //
analyzed: gsang ba dag ces bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyi don to //
translated: The secret is the meaning of the yoga of the result itself.

original: rnal 'byor pa de ni rang rig pa med par ye shes rig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de ni rang rig pa med par ye shes rig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That yogin, without self-awareness, would not be aware of gnosis.

original: de bas na de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin ye shes brtags pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin ye shes brtags pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, their meditative stabilization is the examination of gnosis,

original: ting nge 'dzin ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
translated: meditative stabilization being śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: de gnyis kyis brtags pa ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis brtags pa ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The examination of those two is the application.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes brtags pa nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes brtags pa nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: The examination of the gnosis of meditative stabilization is summarized.

original: las kyi rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: las kyi rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the classification of action,

original: lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “body” and so on.

original: lus la sogs pa'i sgras ni lus la sogs pa'i las rnams yin par bshad de /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i sgras ni lus la sogs pa'i las rnams yin par bshad de /
translated: The words “body” and so on explain the actions of body and so on,

original: dbyer med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyer med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are inseparable.

original: de nyid ni brtags pa ste brtags pa tsam gyis brtan cing nges pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de nyid ni brtags pa ste brtags pa tsam gyis brtan cing nges pa yin pas na /
translated: That itself is imagined, and is firm and certain by mere imagination.

original: lus ngag sems su rnam brtags pa //🔽zhes bya'o // bya ba de ni rgyud de /
analyzed: lus ngag sems su rnam brtags pa // zhes bya'o // bya ba de ni rgyud de /
translated: The imagined body, speech, and mind🔽are the imagined actions.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs par bya ba rab tu brtags shing las rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs par bya ba rab tu brtags shing las rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: That action is the continuum, and the action is well imagined in the Compendium of Principles and so forth, and the activities are posited.

original: de yang rnam pa 'dis bya ba rnam pa gsum gsang ba'i de kho na nyid du gyur par bshad do //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa 'dis bya ba rnam pa gsum gsang ba'i de kho na nyid du gyur par bshad do //
translated: Moreover, by this aspect, the three kinds of action are explained as the secret reality.

original: gang gi yin zhe na /🔽rdo rje las can sna tshogs bzhin //
analyzed: gang gi yin zhe na / rdo rje las can sna tshogs bzhin //
translated: Whose?🔽Of the vajra worker, like the four.

original: zhes bya ba ste rdo rje las kyi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste rdo rje las kyi'o //
translated: The vajra worker is the vajra action.

original: gsang ba ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gsang ba ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the secret?

original: sna tshogs bzhin zhes bya ba ste rdo rje las dang 'dra pa'o /
analyzed: sna tshogs bzhin zhes bya ba ste rdo rje las dang 'dra pa'o /
translated: Like the four, like the vajra action.

original: de bas na skal ba med pa rnams la ba stan par bya ba ma yin pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pas las bya ba de ba stan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na skal ba med pa rnams la ba stan par bya ba ma yin pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pas las bya ba de ba stan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to explain the action that is to be done by the application that is not to be taught to those who are not vessels,

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te las rnams sgrub pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te las rnams sgrub pa'i thabs so //
translated: The “five buddhas” and so on are the means of accomplishing the rites.

original: der phyag rgya bzhi gsang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: der phyag rgya bzhi gsang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: There, with regard to the four seals, the secret empowerment is taught.

original: 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “The great elements” and so on are taught.

original: ji ltar lha mo bzhi dang yang dag par sbyor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lha mo bzhi dang yang dag par sbyor ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that one is truly conjoined with the four goddesses?

original: sa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Earth” and so on is taught.

original: 'dir sa la sogs pa dang / sbyor ba'i rgyu ni dbang chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir sa la sogs pa dang / sbyor ba'i rgyu ni dbang chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the cause of the union with earth and so on is taught with “great power” and so on.

original: 'og nas dkyil 'khor ro zhes @134a * //
analyzed: 'og nas dkyil 'khor ro zhes @134a * //
translated: Later, the “maṇḍala” is explained.

original: bshad pa dang thams cad du spyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa dang thams cad du spyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied everywhere.

original: dbang chen la sogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs dang las rnams ba stan par bya ba'i phyir dbang chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang chen la sogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs dang las rnams ba stan par bya ba'i phyir dbang chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the colors, shapes, and functions of great power and so on, “great power” and so on are taught.

original: dbyibs rnam pa gnyis te /🔽la la ni dbang du bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbyibs rnam pa gnyis te / la la ni dbang du bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: There are two types of shapes:🔽some are like subjugation,

original: la la ni mngon spyod lta bu'o //
analyzed: la la ni mngon spyod lta bu'o //
translated: and some are like killing.

original: 'byung ba che'i bdag nyid las grub pa zhes bya ba ni spyan la sogs pa lha mo bzhi'i sbyor ba ste /🔽de ni ci rigs par las kyi dngos grub rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba che'i bdag nyid las grub pa zhes bya ba ni spyan la sogs pa lha mo bzhi'i sbyor ba ste / de ni ci rigs par las kyi dngos grub rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The “accomplishment of the four actions” is the four accomplishments of action, which are the four goddesses Locanā and so on.🔽They are the cause of the four accomplishments of action,

original: las rnam pa bzhi'i dngos grub kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: las rnam pa bzhi'i dngos grub kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: which are the four accomplishments of action.

original: gsang ba'i ye shes bla med yin //
analyzed: gsang ba'i ye shes bla med yin //
translated: The supreme secret intuition.

original: zhes bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to that, he declares,

original: las kyi dngos grub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: las kyi dngos grub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The accomplishment of action, etc. ”

original: las kyi dngos grub mchog ces bya ba ni las kyi dngos grub dam pa'i rgyu yin pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi dngos grub mchog ces bya ba ni las kyi dngos grub dam pa'i rgyu yin pa'o //
translated: The “supreme accomplishment of action” is the cause of the supreme accomplishment of action.

original: de gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: las kyi dngos grub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: las kyi dngos grub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He declares, “The accomplishment of action, etc. ”

original: 'khor los sgyur ba rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang rdo rje rin chen dang rdo rje chos dang rdo rje las te /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang rdo rje rin chen dang rdo rje chos dang rdo rje las te /
translated: The “four types of world-emperor” are Vajrasattva, Vajraratna, Vajradharma, and Vajrakarma.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba bzhi'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba bzhi'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by the yoga of the four world-emperors.

original: spyan gyi tshul zhes bya ba ni spyan gyi rnal 'byor bya'o //
analyzed: spyan gyi tshul zhes bya ba ni spyan gyi rnal 'byor bya'o //
translated: The method of the eye is the yoga of the eye.

original: padma'i rdo rje can zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag med pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i rdo rje can zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag med pa'o //
translated: The one with the lotus vajra is Amitābha.

original: rnam par snang mdzad gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad lta bur ro //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad lta bur ro //
translated: The abode of Vairocana is like Vairocana.

original: rdo rje khro bo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gnod spyin dang gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo drag po rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gnod spyin dang gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo drag po rnams so //
translated: The vajra wrathful ones are the fierce wrathful ones such as Vajrayakṣa and Yamāntaka.

original: bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum char la yang tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum char la yang tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
translated: One should meditate is the remainder of the sentence for all three.

original: las kyi dus ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: las kyi dus ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the time of action,

original: zhi ba dgongs ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba dgongs ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: he says, “The peaceful one at the end of the night,” and so on.

original: las rnams la me tog dang rnyan dang gos la sogs pa'i mdog ba stan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: las rnams la me tog dang rnyan dang gos la sogs pa'i mdog ba stan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to teach the colors of the flowers, images, clothes, and so on for the actions,

original: zhi ba la dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, “White for the peaceful,” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the reality of the five buddhas,🔽he says, “The color of the five buddhas,” and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: The term samādhi and so on is stated.

original: ting nge 'dzin ye shes kyi mngon bar byang chub pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ye shes kyi mngon bar byang chub pa lnga ste /
translated: The five manifest enlightenments of the knowledge of meditative concentration are stated beginning with meditative concentration.

original: de las yang dag par 'byung ba'i las kyi sgrib pa gang yin pa de ni dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de las yang dag par 'byung ba'i las kyi sgrib pa gang yin pa de ni dam pa yin no //
translated: The obscuration of karma that arises from those is the highest.

original: mngon par byang chub pa lnga nyid ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa lnga nyid ba stan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just the five manifest enlightenments,🔽he says,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Buddha, and so on.

original: bsgoms na @134b dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar spyar te /
analyzed: bsgoms na @134b dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar spyar te /
translated: One should understand that if one meditates, it becomes pure.

original: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
analyzed: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
translated: Om, I generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba bsgoms na dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bsgoms na dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one meditates, it becomes pure.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du rang gi sems dag par mthong bai phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du rang gi sems dag par mthong bai phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees one's mind as pure in the aspect of a moon disc.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One is the Bhagavān.

original: aom bo dhi tsittam autp'a da y'a mi /
analyzed: aom bo dhi tsittam autp'a da y'a mi /
translated: Om, I generate the vajra mind.

original: zhes pa sgoms na dang po'i zla ba'i steng du zla ba gnyis pa'i rnam pa bha ga zhes bshad pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: zhes pa sgoms na dang po'i zla ba'i steng du zla ba gnyis pa'i rnam pa bha ga zhes bshad pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pas na /
translated: If one meditates on this, then the Bhagavān is the form of the second moon on the first moon, and is endowed with the bodhicitta explained as the bhaga.

original: bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: He becomes the Bhagavān.

original: sangs rgyas 'gyur zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas ni shes rab ste ji skad du bshad pa'i bha ga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'gyur zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas ni shes rab ste ji skad du bshad pa'i bha ga'o //
translated: Buddhahood is wisdom, which is the bhaga as explained.

original: de dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur par bsgoms na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur par bsgoms na /
translated: If one meditates on the one who is endowed with that as having become a buddha,
